text: Despite concerns by some parents that their NNS receive “ too JJ NNS too soon , ” a JJ NN finds that JJ shots , RB on the same day , do not increase the NN of NN . In the JJ six months of NN , NNS receive as JJ as CD NN doses of six different NNS , and by the NN they are 6 NNS old , a total of 25 doses from 10 NNS . text: On April 30 , the nation reported just four NNS , all of them travellers arriving from abroad , marking the JJ day with zero local infections in CD and a half months . As case numbers have continued to fall , the NN has cautiously relaxed its guidelines , while signaling a shift to " everyday quarantine " measures , such as wearing masks and temperature checks at schools . NNS 's attitudes have RB relaxed , leading some officials to worry about complacency and a second wave of infections . The nightclub outbreak MD heighten those fears , but the NN has already responded aggressively , tracing and testing thousands of NNS in a matter of days . Last mile is the toughest Though testing NNS were quick to respond to the demand , rolling out the kits presented difficulties . Through February , demand for tests was still outpacing supply , and there were only enough kits to distribute to a select number of hospitals . Furthermore , hospitals struggled to administer the tests to potentially contagious patients safely and quickly — testing areas needed to be sanitised after each patient , JJ queues meant the NN MD spread while NNS waited in line , and NN workers were running low on protective gear . At Yangji Hospital , this RB led to exhausted staff , VBZ hospital director Sang Il Kim . " RB when we did have kits , the waiting times were just too JJ for everybody to VB tested , so they MD have to VB to other hospitals , " adds Yoona Chung , a NN in the hospital 's surgery department . According to Yangji's data , the hospital was conducting roughly 10 tests a day by late February — but JJ more were being turned away due to the wait . Other hospitals in Korea started experimenting with drive - through testing centres , where patients MD VB tested without leaving their cars . But Yangji Hospital is near a subway station in a crowded neighbourhood in southern Seoul ; for JJ of its patients , cars are n't an option . So , Kim devised the walk - in booths , which went into pilot operation on March 10 . Within days , the number of tests administered in a day had tripled . By the end of the month , the hospital MD handle more than 90 patients a day . Hospitals elsewhere in Korea and around the NN quickly adopted their own variations on the concept . A hospital in Busan had a similar idea independently but others have had NN from Kim .

text: The FBI disproved its main NN about how the anthrax spores were weaponized . The investigation of the 2001 anthrax attacks ended as far as the public knew on July 29 , 2008 , with the death of Bruce Ivins , a senior biodefense researcher at the U.S. Army Medical NNP Institute of Infectious Diseases ( USAMRIID ) in Fort Detrick , Md. The NN of death was an overdose of the painkiller Tylenol . No autopsy was performed , and there was no suicide note . Less than a week after his apparent suicide , the FBI declared Ivins to have been the sole perpetrator of the 2001 Anthrax attacks , and the person who mailed deadly anthrax spores to NBC , the NNP York Post , and Sens . Tom Daschle and Patrick Leahy . These attacks killed five NNS , closed down a Senate office building , caused a national panic , and nearly paralyzed the postal system . The FBI ’s six - NN investigation was the largest inquest in its history , involving 9,000 interviews , 6,000 subpoenas , and the examination of tens of thousands of photocopiers , typewriters , computers and mailboxes . Yet it failed to find a shred of evidence that identified the anthrax killer–or RB a witness to the mailings . With the NN of a task force of NNS , it VBD a flask of anthrax that closely matched –through its genetic markers –the anthrax used in the attack . This flask had been in the custody of Ivins , who had published no fewer than 44 scientific papers over three decades as a microbiologist and who was working on developing NNS against anthrax . As custodian , he provided samples of it to other NNS at Fort Detrick , the Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus , Ohio , and other facilities involved in anthrax NN . According to the FBI ’s reckoning , over 100 NNS had been given access to it . Any of these NNS ( or their co-workers ) MD have stolen a minute quantity of this anthrax and , by mixing it into a NN of NN and nutrients , used it to grow enough spores to launch the anthrax attacks .

text: A shot in the dark ? Some say NN NN hard to find Some parts of the country are experiencing spot shortages of NN NN because of increased demand in a NN season that started earlier and is more severe than previous NNS . In Las Vegas , Celeste Tom tried six times before she VBD a NN shot for her boyfriend . " I 'd been bugging him to VB a NN shot , but he kept putting it off , " VBD Tom , 55 . The Smith 's Food and Drug Center where she got her shot was out . Her partner called his NN 's office , but they were out , too . Next she tried a Walgreens and then a CVS pharmacy ; no NN . She called another Smith's , but it MD administer NN only to NNS over 65 . On Monday , she VBD a Walgreens that had 10 doses left . " I called RB when he got off work at 1 p.m. to make sure they still had some , and he finally went in . " " The bottom line is there 's NN out there , " VBD Tom Skinner , a spokesman for the Centers for NNP NNP and Prevention . " There MD be places where there are spot shortages , but there should be a little bit more coming , so NNS MD have to check around for it . " It took Pam Copley a full day . The Staten Island , N.Y. , mom , 42 , tried her pediatrician , but the office had no appointments until February . She and daughter Colleen , 15 , got in line at a CVS , only to have the nurse come and and say she did n't have shots for anyone under 18 . After " a bunch of phone calls , " Copley VBD NN at an urgent - care clinic . They had to wait there for five hours , but it was worth it , she VBD . " There 's lots of NN in the schools here RB now . U.S. NN NN manufacturers have increased the number of doses they expect to produce this NN to 145 million from previous estimates of 137 million , Skinner VBD . About 128 million doses have been shipped , and the " vast majority " of those have been used , he VBD . " We had 112 million NNS vaccinated by the end of November . " The CDC is working with the National Influenza NNP Summit , a coalition that monitors the NN and NN supply , to tell doctors and other NN care providers which distributors and NN manufacturers have NN available to order , Skinner VBD . " Spot shortages are not due to any manufacturing issues , " VBD Rita Chappelle , a spokeswoman for the Food and Drug Administration . It 's more an effect of a mild NN season last NN and a more severe NN this NN . " Demand for the NN is high . " Ordering NN NN can be a challenge , VBD Cameron Wolfe with the division of infectious diseases at Duke NNP School of Medicine in Durham , N.C . It requires " pharmacies , physicians ' offices and clinics to pre-order their supply , and given the variability in the NN season , it is always an educated estimate of what you 'll actually need . " There are CD main NN producers in the NNP NNPS , Sanofi US in Bridgewater , Conn. , and GlaxoSmithKline in Upper Merion , Pa . For the 2012 - 2013 NN season GlaxoSmithKline , RB VBN as GSK , produced about 25 million doses of NN NN . All those 25 million doses of NN NN are spoken for , and shipping will be finished by early to mid-February , GSK spokesman Robert Perry VBD . That does n't mean there 's no more NN NN available to doctors . Much of GSK 's production goes to medical suppliers that take orders from doctors ' offices , Perry VBD . The NN had the capacity to produce more NN shots , but 25 million doses was " what customers VBD us they MD need , " Perry VBD . In the past CD NNS about half of Americans VBP vaccinated . It 's tricky to estimate how much to produce because NN NN takes six to nine months to produce , so manufacturers have to plan production before all the orders are in . GSK began taking orders for this NN season in October 2011 . It will finish taking orders for next NN 's NN season next month . NN care providers base their estimates on previous NN 's demand . A single dose costs $ 7.90 to $ 8.85 wholesale , and doctors are careful not to order too much . It 's still not too late to VB vaccinated . NN seasons are unpredictable in their length , and it 's unclear whether NNS are still building or beginning to wane , according to the CDC . " Being vaccinated with the NN NN each NN remains the best NN to prevent the NN , " Chappelle VBD . NN on NN NN availability is at www.flu.gov.

text: Emily P. Wen , PhD , is currently a NN Fellow at the Merck NNP Laboratory in the department of NNP Process Development . Dr. Wen has led process developments for several major NN products from Phase I to Phase III clinical trials , including NNS against hepatitis B , Haemophilus influenzae type b , Pneumococcal , Meningococcal , and Group B Streptococcus . Ronald J. Ellis , PhD , is Chief Technology Officer at FutuRx Ltd in Israel . Dr. Ellis has > 30 NNS of industry experience in line and senior management in JJ NNS , including roles as project leader and champion of projects that resulted in 5 licensed NNS which accrue ~ $ 4B in annual sales . Dr. Pujar has contributed to a variety of NNS and biologics products and product candidates . text: Jeff Bradstreet , who has been described as a “ controversial NN researcher , ” has now become the center of NN rumors after reports of his apparent suicide . His death is VBN to have followed on the heels of a raid by the US Food and Drug Administration ( FDA ) of his Bradstreet Wellness Center in Buford , Georgia ( update 27JUN2015 : the Georgia Drugs and Narcotics Agency is reported to have aided in the raid ) . A fisherman VBD Bradstreet ’s NN in a North Carolina river on Friday , June CD . Authorities in Rutherford County , North Carolina , VBP that he had a gunshot wound to the chest , “ which appears to be self - inflicted , ” according to the local newspaper , the Gwinnett Daily Post . The Post RB reports that That speculation has spread IN a NN through the community of NNS who are mourning the loss of a NN whom they viewed as a courageous crusader against mainstream medicine and who VBP , as Bradstreet argued , that the mercury in NNS causes NN ( the evidence emphatically indicates otherwise ) . According to his website , Bradstreet , whose own son is autistic , embraced a number of unproven or untested interventions for NN , including using stem cells in an overseas NN he chronicles , and hyperbaric oxygen therapy , which the FDA cracked down on in 2013 . He was VBN for his use of chelation therapy . As I ’ve written about here before , those who are attracted to NN theories to explain their NN have a tendency to VB NN all around them . With the death of Bradstreet , this tendency is emerging in force . A related fundraiser with the title “ Finding out the NN ” references an “ exhaustive investigation into the possibility of foul play . ” At last look , the funds raised were in the low five figures . Some seem to VB that the location of the wound suggests foul play , but about a fifth of suicides by gunshot involve a wound to the chest . A handgun RB was VBN in the river where Bradstreet ’s NN was discovered . Studies of NNS who are prone to subscribe to NN theories indicate that readers drawn to NN - related online NN tend to be more focused on what filters into their narrow , NN - oriented communities , reinforcing confirmation biases and adding fuel to the conspiratorial machine . In the US , “ conspiracist beliefs , ” which are widespread , correlate with being more likely to use alternative medicine and to shun mainstream medicine , RB to the point of being less likely to have an annual physical . Researchers call the internet a “ natural medium ” for the diffusion of NN theories , and the rapidity with which this NN spread and took hold is no exception .

text: by Ashley AustrewPoliticians are n’t exactly VBN for being honest . NNP Nixon had the Watergate scandal . NNP Bill NNP lied about his affair with Monica Lewinsky . And , in the JJ CD NNS Donald NNP was NN , the Washington Post reported he ’s made over 8,000 “ false or misleading claims ” to the American public . Still , it is rare to VB a headline declaring any NN or politician a liar . Why is that ? RB of all , what does it mean to lie ? The noun and verb lie are both recorded in Old English by the 900s . To lie is “ to speak falsely or utter NN knowingly , as with intent to deceive . ” More generally , to lie is “ to express what is false , convey a false impression . ” So , when a person lies , they are n’t just sharing false NN , they ’re doing it with the sinister intent of getting others to VB misleading NN . If someone does this habitually , then we MD call them a liar , “ a person who tells lies . ” This word is RB attested to in the 900s . Why do n’t journalists use the word liar ? The main reason why JJ journalists avoid accusations of lying is because it is difficult to determine CD key word in that definition above : intent . If a lie is “ a false statement that is made with deliberate intent to deceive , ” then calling someone a liar means you VBP they are intentionally trying to mislead NNS . While JJ of us make that assumption about politicians , it ’s different when you ’re a member of the NN tasked with reporting the NN — not your own conclusions about it . David Greenberg , a professor of history and NN studies at Rutgers NNP and a contributing editor at Politico , wrote in 2017 that the NN declaring the NN a liar MD cross a serious line . That ’s not to say that it should never be done . Prior to the Watergate scandal , as Greenberg observed , a National Press Club report VBD Nixon guilty of “ an unprecedented , NN - wide effort to VB , restrict and conceal NN ” and “ discredit the press . ” Still , it was n’t until the Watergate NN broke and investigations proved Nixon ’s intent that the NN declared the NN a liar . If the NN wants to retain their credibility , Greenberg argued , they are JJ to hold RB from declaring NNP NNP , or anyone else , a liar . “ Though it MD seem fainthearted to use words IN ‘ falsehood ’ and ‘ untruth , ’ in the JJ run the press will have more influence if it avoids insinuating more than it can confidently assert to be true , ” he wrote . Should journalists use liar anyways ? On January 21 , 2019 , the Washington Post reported that , in the JJ CD NNS of his presidency alone , NNP made 8,158 false claims about the economy , immigration , trade , foreign policy , and other matters . In just CD instance in March 2019 , NNP wrongly identified Patrick Moore , a NN with early involvement in Greenpeace , as a cofounder of the organization in a tweet about him calling NN NN “ JJ NN . ” Greenpeace was quick to correct NNP on the fact that Moore was not a cofounder , but that did n’t VB the fact that JJ NNS were exposed to the tweet and MD have accepted the NN ’s words as true . Since the 2016 US presidential election , NNS have grown increasingly frustrated with the NN ’s NN of public figures who lie , with JJ concerned that we live in a post - NN society where facts have become irrelevant . And , it ’s not only NNP . That election brought us the Hillary NNP email scandal , during which NNP VBD she “ never received nor sent any material that was marked classified ” on her private email server as Secretary of NNP — a claim that Politifact characterized as false . During the 2016 presidential election , Politifact RB VBD that 84 percent of claims Ben Carson , now Secretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development , made since 2007 were false , including his assertion that there are a “ multitude ” of unnecessary NNS available to the public . Texas Senator Ted Cruz VBD lies about 66 percent of the NN in that NN frame , including that “ the federal NN is VBG after school districts , trying to force them to let boys shower with little girls . ” Blurring the lines between fact and fiction RB more , NNP has popularized the term JJ NN — not to call out actual JJ NN but to discredit anyone or anything perceived as unflattering to him . That strategy has been incredibly effective , and he has succeeded in creating an environment in which the NN is difficult to discern . JJ argue that the NN simply can’t tolerate this level of misinformation anymore . RB journalists are starting to call CD another out . In January , Esquire published an op -ed by journalist Dan Sinker called “ In 2019 , The NN Has to Do Better in Calling Out NNP ’s Sh*t [ edited ] . ” Sinker noted that journalists do n’t use words IN lie and liar because they ’re supposed to maintain a level of objectivity . Nonetheless , he added : Of course , being objective does n’t mean letting liars lie . “ Balance ” is n’t setting CD pundits up to argue over what everyone knows is a false statement . There ’s no bias in saying something is patently untrue if it is , in fact , patently untrue . In fact , saying things are n’t true from jump is kinda the most important part of the job . Some major NN organizations have indeed been using the word liar in content . In August 2018 , The NNP Yorker ran the headline “ It ’s True : NNP Is Lying More & He ’s Doing It On Purpose . ” In October , CNN published “ Donald NNP Lies And He ’s Doing A Lot More of It Lately . ” The Atlantic joined the call - out in November 2018 with a piece simply titled : “ The NNP ’s Lies . ” In the era of JJ NN , publications have to contend with the fact that any escalation on their part ( i.e. , calling someone a liar ) , RB comes with an escalation in the intense scrutiny the NN is already facing . The NN has the unique ability to speak NN to power , and that includes calling out politicians and not allowing them to VB away with lies . There MD be disagreement on where the liar line should be , but that does n’t VB the fact that we need to draw CD — RB if intent is tricky to determine . Ashley Austrew is a freelance writer from Omaha , Nebraska . Her work has been published at Cosmopolitan , Scary Mommy , Scholastic , and other outlets . text: NN , RB called rubeola , is a viral infection that 's CD of the most contagious infectious diseases in the NN . The NN is marked by NNS that are similar to a common cold , as well as a characteristic red rash . Between 2000 and 2010 , the JJ incidence of NNS decreased by 66 % and the mortality caused by the NN decreased 74 % , according to a report published in the journal The Lancet . Less than CD decades ago , NNS was almost wiped out in the NNP NNPS , thanks to NNS . But recently , the NN has had a resurgence . Globally , the number of NNS has jumped 30 % due to NN hesitancy . More than 760 NNS of NNS were reported in the U.S. between Jan. 1 and NNP 3 , 2019 , according to Dr. Deepa Mukundan , a pediatric infectious diseases specialist at the NNP of Toledo Medical Center in Ohio . This is up from 372 NNS over the entire NN in 2018 and up from 120 NNS over the entire NN in 2017 , according to the Centers for NNP NNP and Prevention ( CDC ) . How contagious is it ? NN is caused by NN morbillivirus , a NN in the paramyxoviridae family . According to the CDC , the NNS NN settles in the nose and throat mucus of an infected person . When a person infected with the NN coughs , sneezes or exhales , the NN becomes airborne and can spread to other NNS . " The NN can remain in the air for significant periods of NN , " Mukundan VBD Live NNP . " PRP can VB the NNS just by being in a room where a person with NNS has been , RB up to 2 hours after that person has left . " Indeed , the NN is incredibly contagious — 90 % of NNS who are not vaccinated against NNS will become infected if they share NN with someone who has the NN . " Another reason that it is transmitted so effectively is because the hallmark of NNS , the rash , only comes several days after someone is contagious , " VBD Dr. Jennifer Lighter , a pediatric infectious NN specialist at NNP York NNP Langone NNP . Therefore , infected individuals can spread the NN for several days before realizing they 're ill . The contagious period lasts about four days before and four days after the rash appears . A person with NNS is likely to infect between 5 and 18 unvaccinated NNS , according to a 2019 review published in the journal Emerging Infectious Diseases . Most NNS of NNS VBP some combination of cough , runny nose , red eyes , high fever and tiny white to bluish spots in the mouth , VBD Dr. Aileen M. Marty , a professor of infectious diseases at Florida International NNP 's Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine in Miami . As the infection progresses , the characteristic red rash will develop . The rash typically looks IN JJ , red , JJ splotches on the NN . To test for NNS , a NN will examine the patient for telltale NNS , such as spots inside of the mouth and the NN rash . If the NN has any doubt , they MD order a NN test to confirm infection , according to the Mayo Clinic . Almost all NNS require NN by a NN . " This is a NN where complications are common — complications such as ear infection ( acute otitis NN ) , diarrhea and dehydration , pneumonia , encephalitis and JJ death , " Marty VBD Live NNP . " In the NNP NNPS , CD to three of every 1,000 infected persons will die from [ NNS ] complications — which is better than in the Third NNP , where as JJ as CD to 15 per 100 infected persons die from NNS and its complications . " Young NNS are much more susceptible to the NN . According to the Mayo Clinic , NNS kills 100,000 NNS a NN , most under the age of 5 . Pregnant women and those with a compromised immune system are RB at NN of severe complications . There is no specific drug for treating NNS . Instead , doctors treat the NNS . " This means we provide / advise hydration , antipyretics ( e.g. , acetaminophen ) for comfort and fever NN , airway humidification in patients with respiratory tract involvement , " Marty VBD . Though not licensed in the NNP NNPS for the NN of NNS , some pediatricians have used Ribavirin , an antiviral medication , to treat severe pneumonia caused by NNS , Marty added . To protect those who have been exposed to the NN but have not been vaccinated , a NN MD order a post - exposure NN . If given within 72 hours of exposure , the NN MD prevent the NNS . RB if it does n't prevent the NN , the vaccinated patient will only have a mild case of the NNS , according to the Mayo Clinic . Another NN to protect at - NN individuals is to inject them with immune serum globulin ( antibodies or proteins derived from the NN of donors with NNS immunity ) within six days of exposure to the NN . IN a NN , this NN can prevent NNS or make the onset less severe . For JJ NNS , recovering from the NNS includes resting at home until the NNS subside . It is important for patients to drink plenty of fluids to replace fluids lost during fevers . It MD RB be helpful to use a humidifier to relieve congestion and to block out bright lights that MD bother sensitive eyes , according to the Mayo Clinic . Once the NN has run its course , the person will be immune to the NN . However , the immune system MD be significantly weakened for up to 2 NNS after recovering from the NNS , according to Lighter . During this NN , NNS can be more susceptible to secondary viral and bacterial infections , which MD VB more complications than the original NNS infection . The best NN to prevent NNS is by NN . The CDC recommends 2 doses of the NN ; the JJ for those between 12 and 15 months of age and the second for NNS between 4 and 6 NNS of age . The NN is 97 % effective for those who receive both doses and about 93 % effective for those receiving CD . Getting the proper vaccinations not only protects the individual receiving the NN , it RB protects those who cannot be vaccinated : those allergic to components of the NN , those with a compromised immune system or those too young to receive the NN . " NNS are CD of the most effective tools we have to protect public NN and prevent deaths around the NN , " VBD Dr. Scott Lillibridge , an infectious NN expert and professor at the Texas A&M NNP NNP Center School of Public NNP . About 94 % of the U.S. population is vaccinated against NNS , according to Mukundan , although there are pockets of NNS who delay or refuse NNS . The groups of unvaccinated NNS make it difficult to VB the spread of NNS , she VBD . " All NNS outbreaks in the U.S. start either with a visiting international traveler infected with NNS or from an unvaccinated U.S. resident returning from an international trip with a NN infection , " Mukundan VBD . The infection is then spread to others in the community who are unvaccinated . Most NN NNS occur in locations with groups of unvaccinated individuals , according to the CDC . In 2000 , the U.S. declared that NNS was effectively eliminated in the country . But since then , the NN has been making a comeback , likely due to anti-vaxxers . " The antivax movement is a small percentage of the population but they are loud and draw a lot of undue NN attention , " Lighter VBD . Anti-vaxxers are driven by emotion rather than the NN behind the NNS , she VBD . Modern opposition to NNS is largely fueled by religious beliefs and the unwarranted concern that NNS are somehow linked to NN , among other reasons , according to the NNP & Rubella Initiative , a collaboration of the NN 's largest NN organizations that aims to eliminate NNS and rubella . Before the NNS NN approval in 1963 , an estimated 3 to 4 million NNS in the U.S. contracted the NNS per NN , with 400 to 500 dying from complications , according to the CDC . Introduction of the NN led to a greater than 99 % reduction in NNS NNS in the U.S. A wealth of NN has confirmed that there is no relationship between NNS and NN and has repeatedly validated the safety of the NNS NN . " Protect yourself and your loved ones by making sure that they are up to date on the NNS NN , " Mukundan VBD . " Prevention , meaning NN , is always better than cure . text: This schedule of recommended immunizations MD vary depending upon where you live , your NN 's NN , the type of NN , and the NNS available . Some of the NNS MD be given as part of a combination NN so that a NN gets fewer shots . Talk with your NN about which NNS your kids need . • HepB : Hepatitis B NN . Ideally , the JJ dose is given within 24 hours of birth , but kids not previously immunized can VB it at any age . Some low birth weight infants will VB it at 1 month or when they 're discharged from the hospital . • HepB : Second dose should be given 1 to 2 months after the JJ dose . • Hib : This third dose MD be needed , depending on the brand of NN used in previous Hib immunizations . • RV : This third dose MD be needed , depending on the brand of NN used in previous RV immunizations . • Influenza ( NN ) : The NN NN is recommended every NN for NNS 6 months and older : • Kids younger than 9 who VBP the NN NN for the JJ NN ( or who have only had CD dose before July 2019 ) will VB it in 2 separate doses at least a month apart . • Those younger than 9 who have had at least 2 doses of NN NN previously ( in the same or different seasons ) will only need 1 dose . • Kids older than 9 need only 1 dose . • The NN is given by injection with a needle ( the NN shot ) or by nasal spray . Both types of NN can be used this NN season ( 2019 –2020 ) because they seem to work equally well . Your NN will recommend which to use based on your NN 's age and general NN . The nasal spray is only for healthy NNS ages 2 –49 . NNS with weak immune systems or some NN conditions ( such as asthma ) and pregnant women should not VB the nasal spray NN . • HepA : Hepatitis A NN ; given as 2 shots at least 6 months apart • HPV : JJ papillomavirus NN , given in 2 shots over a 6 - to 12 - month period . It can be given as early as age 9 . For teens and young adults ( ages 15 – 26 in girls and boys both ) , it is given in 3 shots over 6 months . It 's recommended for both girls and boys to prevent genital warts and some types of cancer . • Tdap : Tetanus , diphtheria , and pertussis booster . RB recommended during each pregnancy a woman has . • Meningococcal conjugate NN : And a booster dose is recommended at age 16 . • Meningococcal B NN ( MenB ) : The MenB NN MD be given to kids and teens in 2 or 3 doses , depending on the brand . Unlike the meningococcal conjugate NN , which is recommended , the decision to VB the MenB NN is made by the teens , their parents , and the NN . • HepA can be given as early as 6 months of age to babies who will travel to a place where hepatitis A is common ( they will still need routine NN after their JJ birthday ) . It 's RB recommended for older kids who did not VB it in the past . • The MMR NN can be given to babies as young as 6 months old if they will be traveling internationally . These NNS should still VB the recommended routine doses at 12 – 15 months and 4 –6 NNS of age , but can VB the second dose as early as 4 weeks after the JJ if they will still be traveling and at NN . • The NN NN is especially important for kids who are at NN for NN problems from the NN . High - NN groups include , but are n't limited to , kids younger than 5 NNS old and those with chronic medical conditions , such as asthma , heart problems , sickle cell NN , diabetes , or HIV . • Pneumococcal NNS can be given to older kids ( age 2 and up ) who have conditions that affect their immune systems , such as asplenia or HIV infection , or other conditions , IN a cochlear implant , chronic heart NN , or chronic lung NN . • The meningococcal NNS can be given to kids as young as 8 weeks old ( depending on the NN brand ) who are at NN for a meningococcal infection , such as meningitis . This includes NNS with some immune disorders . Kids who live in ( or will travel to ) NNS where meningitis is common , or where there is an outbreak , RB should VB the NN . Note : An outbreak is when a NN happens in greater numbers than expected in a particular area . If you have questions about vaccinating your family during an outbreak , ask your NN care provider or contact your NN or local NN department .

text: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are fronting a JJ NN looking at mental NN issues amid the NN NN . They have been interviewed on the BBC about the scheme - called Every Mind Matters . text: THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary NNP NNP Unveils Millennium Initiative to Promote Delivery of Existing NNPS in Developing NNS and Accelerate Development of NNP NNPS In his NN of the Union address , NNP NNP will call for concerted international action to combat infectious diseases in developing NNS . These diseases VBP almost half of all deaths worldwide of NNS under age 45 , killing over eight million NNS each NN and orphaning millions more . The NNP committed the NNP NNPS to addressing this terrible problem in his September speech to the NNP Nations General Assembly . Now the NNP is asking for foundations , pharmaceutical NNS , international agencies , and other governments to join us in this task , and he is announcing these specific elements of his Millennium Initiative : • A JJ financial commitment to purchase and deliver existing NNS in poor NNS . As Vice NNP Gore VBD the U. N. Security Council earlier this month , the Administration�s FY 2001 budget will include a proposed $ 50 million contribution to the NN purchase fund of the NNP Alliance for NNPS and Immunization ( GAVI ) . • Increased investments in NN in developing NNS . The NNP is calling on the NNP Bank and other multilateral development banks to dedicate an additional $ 400 million to $ 900 million annually of their low - interest - rate loans to expand immunization , prevent and treat infectious diseases , and build effective delivery systems for other basic NN services . These investments are as central to JJ progress as investments in education and physical infrastructure , and they MD build on the JJ focus on basic NN services that we have supported as part of the Highly Indebted Poor NNPS ( HIPC ) debt initiative . This proposed shift in existing resources does not require additional U.S. budget expenditures . • A significant increase in basic NN on diseases that affect developing nations . The Administration�s FY 2001 budget for the National Institutes of NNP includes a sharp step - up in NN critical to the development of NNS for malaria , tuberculosis , and HIV / AIDS . • A JJ tax credit for sales of NNS for malaria , tuberculosis , and HIV / AIDS to accelerate the invention and production of these NNS . Because developing NNS often cannot afford to buy NNS , the market provides little incentive for pharmaceutical NNS to develop NNS for diseases that disproportionately affect those NNS . This tax credit MD provide such an incentive , because every dollar paid by a qualifying organization to buy a qualifying NN MD be matched by a dollar of tax credits � representing up to $ 1 billion of additional funding for future NN purchases . The NNP is calling on other governments to make similar purchase commitments , so that we can ensure a future market for these critically needed NNS . Infectious Diseases Pose a Mounting JJ and JJ Burden on Developing NNS � And a Threat to Our NN As Well . • More than eight million NNS die each NN of centuries - old diseases IN malaria , tuberculosis , and respiratory and diarrheal diseases . Deaths from the modern scourge of AIDS are climbing rapidly . Altogether , as JJ NNS die of infectious diseases each NN as the total number of combatants who perished in NNP War I . • In an interconnected and highly mobile NN , NN crises in other NNS are a threat to everyone . We have seen this with HIV / AIDS , with the resurfacing of tuberculosis , and with the outbreak last NN of West Nile encephalitis in NNP York . According to the NNP NNP Council , during the past 50 NNS , at least five times as JJ Americans have died from communicable diseases that have come from the developing NN than have died in military conflicts . NNS Are CD of the Most Cost - Effective Ways to Improve the Well - Being and Productivity of the Poorest NNS � And Medicines and Other Basic NN Services Are a Necessary Complement . • It costs about $ 17 to immunize a NN , but millions of NNS die each NN of diseases that MD be prevented by existing NNS . Indeed , NNS in developing nations are 10 times more likely to die of a NN - preventable NN than NNS in developed nations . And these tragedies occur in spite of the enormous efforts of UNICEF and others to vaccinate NNS , which save 3 million lives each NN . • Highly effective NNS do not yet exist for malaria , TB and AIDS , which take over 5 million lives each NN . But developed nations have the scientific and technological capacity to make JJ NNS possible . For example , recent work on genetic sequencing , including the JJ genome , will open vast possibilities . • Another NN investment with very high returns is simple preventive and curative services . Providing this basic NN care together with NNS MD save millions of lives each NN . A $ 50 Million Contribution to GAVI to Buy NNS For NNS � Which Will Save Lives Now and Create Confidence that a Market for JJ NNS Will Exist in the Future . • GAVI , the NNP Alliance for NNPS and Immunization , was formed as a collaborative effort of UNICEF , the NNP NNP Organization ( WHO ) , the NNP Bank , private foundations , bilateral aid agencies ( including the U.S. Agency for International Development ) , industry representatives , and developing NNS . GAVI established the � NNP Fund for Children�s NNPS � with an initial grant of $ 750 million over 5 NNS from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation . The formal launch of GAVI , and the official announcement of the Gates gift , will occur shortly in Davos , Switzerland . • A U.S. contribution will VB to purchase NNS for Hepatitis B , Haemophilus Influenzae B ( Hib ) , and Yellow Fever , along with related safe delivery equipment such as auto - destruct syringes . To ensure that GAVI�s NN purchases complement , rather than replace , existing NN efforts , they will be conditional on a country achieving 50 percent coverage of the DTP ( diptheria - tetanus - pertussis ) NN , which is included along with NNS and polio in the existing EPI ( Expanded Program for Immunization ) . • A U.S. contribution will hopefully catalyze significant contributions from other NNS and foundations . It will RB add crucial credibility to the international community�s commitment to provide a market for JJ NNS when they are developed . We Must Shift Existing International Resources Toward Building NNP Infrastructure in Poor NNPS That Can Deliver NNS and Medicines and Provide Essential Basic NNP Services . • The NNP Bank and other multilateral development banks ( MDBs , such as the African Development Fund ) lend money on highly favorable terms to the world�s poorest NNS . Today , roughly $ 1 billion to $ 1 - 1/ 2 billion of this so - called � concessional funding � is devoted to NN care each NN . The Administration proposes to increase that amount by $ 400 million to $ 900 million per NN , with a focus on : • prevention of diseases using basic measures such as NN and condoms for AIDS , treated bed nets for malaria , and stronger systems for containing TB ; • NN of diseases , including common respiratory and diarrheal infections ; and • The Administration is exploring ways to use the HIPC debt reform to support this part of the Millennium Initiative . CD possibility is to make an increase in NN rates CD of the performance targets monitored in the HIPC progress reports . This MD be accompanied by debtor NNS � agreements to include specific improvements in NN delivery systems as priority uses of debt relief proceeds . We RB expect that all Poverty Reduction Strategy Papers that are prepared for HIPC candidates will discuss the adequacy of budget resources and suggested policy reforms devoted to basic NN care . • This re-direction of resources supports the Administration�s overall strategy for JJ development , which emphasizes poverty reduction and gives a central role to �global public goods � � IN NN or the environment � in which positive actions taken in CD country benefit other NNS as well . To meet this objective , these funds should not come from spending on other basic JJ programs , such as education and NN care . • This aspect of the Millennium Initiative does not require a JJ budgetary commitment by the NNP NNPS ( or other donor NNS ) . However , the U.S. ability to influence the direction of MDB lending and the use of HIPC proceeds depends crucially on meeting our existing commitments to these aid programs . We will work with other G - 8 finance and development ministries to refine this proposal . • A conservative estimate suggests that if basic NN care including immunization were made broadly available , up to 2 million children�s lives MD be saved each NN . Higher Funding for Basic Scientific NNP Through the National Institutes of NNP ( NIH ) and Elsewhere Will Hasten the Development of NNS for Malaria , TB , and AIDS . • The Administration�s FY 2001 budget for NIH includes a significant increase in NN critical to creating NNS for these diseases . For malaria and TB , this increase will build on recent advances in the genetic sequencing of these diseases , which have set the stage for major breakthroughs in NN development . • Funding for NIH malaria NN NN will increase more than 10 percent over the FY 2000 level . Future NN will range from pre-clinical studies aimed at improving our understanding of the malaria parasite , through the development of NN candidates , to clinical trials judging NN efficacy and safety . NIH will RB expand its collaboration with NNS in malaria - endemic regions , especially in Africa , to strengthen those regions � capacity for conducting clinical trials of malaria NNS in the future . • NIH NN on a tuberculosis NN will receive over 40 percent more funding than in FY 2000 and more than double the FY 1999 level . NIH will focus on studying the body�s defense mechanisms against TB , and developing and studying NN candidates . Through its Tuberculosis NNP Unit , NIH supports an international multi-disciplinary team to translate advances in basic NN into JJ tools for fighting TB . • NIH funding for AIDS NN NN will increase substantially in FY 2001 and will have more than doubled since FY 1997 . These additional resources will allow NIH to accelerate basic NN on developing NN candidates and to significantly expand testing of potential NN candidates in both developing and developed NNS . The JJ NNP NNP Center on the NIH campus , which will be occupied this summer , will receive a sizeable increase in funding for the development and pre-clinical testing of HIV NN candidates . • The Administration is providing strong support for the path - breaking NN on infectious diseases being conducted by U.S. military NNS , including the opening ( in October 1999 ) of the Walter Reed Army Institute of NNP / Naval Medical NNP Center . Working in close collaboration with NNS worldwide , military NNS have developed and tested successful NNS against Japanese encephalitis and hepatitis A � and they are working to create NNS and medicines to protect service NNS , travelers , and millions of others from malaria , HIV / AIDS , and other infectious diseases . A JJ Tax Credit MD Effectively Provide Up to $ 1 Billion for Future NN Purchases , Speeding the Invention and Production of JJ NNS . • Current tax law provides substantial incentives for pharmaceutical NN and development , including the NN and experimentation ( R&E ) tax credit , the orphan drug tax credit , and an enhanced deduction for charitable contributions of certain products . Nonetheless , pharmaceutical NNS MD be reluctant to invest in developing NNS for diseases that primarily afflict NNS in poor NNS , because little or no paying market exists in those NNS . • Under the proposal , the seller of a qualified NN MD claim a tax credit equal to 100 percent of the amount paid by a qualifying organization that received a �credit allocation� by the U.S. Agency for International Development ( AID ) . The tax credit MD match the qualified organizations � expenditures dollar - for - dollar , thereby doubling their purchasing power . A qualifying NN MD be a JJ NN that received FDA approval for use against malaria , tuberculosis , HIV / AIDS , or any infectious NN that causes over 1 million deaths annually worldwide . • For 2002 through 2010 , AID MD designate up to $ 1 billion of NN sales as eligible for the credit . This tax credit MD be limited to JJ NNS developed to fight these terrible diseases . The credit MD provide a specific and credible commitment to purchase future NNS at reasonable prices . Together with similar commitments from foundations and other governments , it MD provide a critical and powerful incentive to accelerate NN NN and development .

text: The NNS , mumps and rubella ( MMR ) NN is not linked to development of NN spectrum disorders , RB among NNS considered to be at NN , a JJ JJ NN finds . Among nearly 100,000 NNS , receipt of the MMR NN did not increase the NN for NN spectrum disorder ( ASD ) , regardless of whether kids were at higher NN because an older sibling already had the condition , researchers write in JAMA . " RB for NNS who are high - NN , the NN does not play a role , " VBD lead author Dr. Anjali Jain of healthcare consulting firm The Lewin Group in Falls Church , Virginia . " We do n’t VB what does unfortunately , but it ’s not the MMR NN . " The results should be reassuring , she VBD . NN spectrum disorder is a range of NNS that often includes difficulties with communication and JJ interaction , according to the U.S. National Institute of Mental NNP . It 's MD RB include restricted and repetitive behaviors . The 1998 NN that claimed to find a connection between the MMR NN and ASD was later debunked . The Lancet , the medical journal that originally published it , withdrew it . Studies continue to vouch for the safety of the NN . Still , some NNS continue to VB that the NN is connected to ASD . Parents of NNS with ASD MD RB VB there is a genetic component , and so they decline to vaccinate their other NNS , Jain and colleagues noted in their report in the Journal of the American Medical Association . For the JJ NN , the researchers used insurance claims data on 95,727 NNS followed from birth to at least age five between 2001 and 2012 . They RB had data on the NNS 's older siblings . Overall , about 2 percent of the NNS had an older sibling with ASD . Those NNS were more likely to VB on to develop ASD themselves whether they were vaccinated or not , according to the report . The NN did n't increase their NN , the researchers say . For example , among high - NN five NN olds , ASD developed in 23 of 269 who were n't vaccinated ( 8.6 percent ) , compared to 30 of 796 ( 3.8 percent ) who received CD doses of the MMR NN . Among kids not at high NN of ASD , 7,735 were unvaccinated at age five and 56 ( 0.7 percent ) were diagnosed with the condition . That compared to 244 of 45,568 NNS ( 0.5 percent ) who received CD MMR doses . Furthermore , NNS with an older sibling with ASD were significantly less likely to have received the MMR NN in the JJ place . By age five , about 92 percent of the NNS without ASD in the family had received at least CD MMR dose . By comparison , only 86 percent of NNS with an older sibling with ASD had been vaccinated by that age . " I VBP it ’s important to show that the degree of undervaccination in the families with NNS with NN spectrum disorder was significant , " Jain VBD Reuters NNP . Alongside the lack of association between the NN and ASD , the undervaccination rate deserves attention , she VBD . Roughly a dozen studies have shown that age of ASD onset and its severity do not differ between vaccinated and unvaccinated NNS , wrote Dr. Bryan King , program director of the NNP Center at Seattle NNP 's Hospital , in an editorial accompanying the JJ NN . The JJ NN , King added , now shows that " the NN of ASD recurrence in families does not differ between vaccinated and unvaccinated NNS . "

text: The U.S. NN alone spends $ 200 million a NN on a hunt for a NN against AIDS . At the forefront of that search stands Dr. David Baltimore , chairman of the National Institute of Health's AIDS NNP NNP Committee . Currently NN of the California Institute of Technology as well , Baltimore won the 1975 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine . Betsey Arledge , producer of the NOVA film " Surviving AIDS , " interviewed a cautiously optimistic Baltimore on the current NN of the search for a NN . NOVA : Can you give me a sense of the magnitude of the AIDS epidemic at this NN ? Baltimore : The AIDS epidemic in this country is a serious issue , but it's not a major public NN disaster the NN it is abroad . In the NN today there are something IN 34 million infected NNS , and more NNS are being infected every minute . On the scale of any public NN issue in the NN , this is CD of the major ones . There are more NNS dying of AIDS than of almost any other infectious NN , with tuberculosis and malaria being in the same ballpark . It 's a horrendous situation . ( VB AIDS in Perspective . ) NOVA : Do you VB we 're getting a little complacent in this country ? Baltimore : I 'm impressed that AIDS remains a very noted NN in the NNP NNPS . It 's noted in the newspapers all the NN — what 's VBG on in the NN and in the country . There is very complete coverage of how good the drugs are and where the NN program stands . I do n't VB we 've allowed it to fall off the radar screen . And we do far more AIDS NN than the whole rest of the NN ; in the NN area alone , we do probably 90 percent of the NN . NOVA : Can you give me a sense of the amount of effort — not just money , but intellectual effort — that has gone into trying to find a NN over the past 10 or 15 NNS ? Baltimore : When H.I.V. was RB discovered , the JJ thing that the then -Secretary of what became the U.S. Department of NNP and NNP Services VBD was , " We will have a NN in short order . " She was wrong about that , but it shows that from the very JJ moment a NN was on NNS 's minds . Indeed , there has been a significant effort to make a NN from the very JJ day . I VBP NNS thought it MD be simple , because we 'd made NNS for so JJ different viruses . The polio NN is effective because , for the most part , our bodies naturally fight this NN . This is not the case with HIV . The thing that worried me at the NN — and it has turned out to be the biggest worry — was that if it were possible to make a NN , why does n't the NN ordinarily fight off the NN ? Most viruses we fight off very well , including polio and RB smallpox . A certain fraction of NNS MD be maimed or killed by those viruses , but the much larger fraction of NNS VBP over them . That 's not true for H.I.V . We knew that from very early on . At RB we thought it might be that JJ NNS MD be killed by it , and then we began to realize that almost everybody who had the infection was potentially VBG to be killed by it . That 's fundamentally different than other viruses . And that fundamental difference was a red flag . The initial impetus that we'd be able to do it , it 's around the corner , was just all wrong . NOVA : So the search for a NN has been a real struggle ? Baltimore : It 's been an enormous struggle , because the obvious things did n't work , and NNS got very frustrated by that . The next question became : Where do you turn ? What 's not obvious ? What can we do ? That involved bringing a whole different level of NNS into the discussion . Not the ordinary NNS who make NNS , but NNS whose scientific focus is in other areas of immunology , of infectious NN — basic NNS . So it 's been a ramping up process to VB more and more NNS involved and thinking about it . Perhaps the most important role of the committee I 'm now heading is to galvanize the scientific community to find JJ routes in thinking about a NN , so that maybe we can find a NN through some very non-traditional approach . NOVA : An international team of NNS announced recently that they had traced the origin of the AIDS NN to a subspecies of chimpanzee in Africa . If this report is verified , how will it VB in the search for a NN ? Baltimore : In NN , it will not have much effect on the search for a NN . However , it tells us a lot about why HIV is so hard to counter . It is not a NN that is native to the JJ NNS , and therefore it is continually mutating in an effort to adapt . Most JJ viruses are well - controlled by the JJ immune system , because they have evolved with it , and the CD opposing forces are in a steady - NN . We cannot wait until we and HIV evolve to being comfortable with each other . We must devise a NN , effectively short - circuiting the usual process of adaptation . NOVA : Who are the so - called JJ - term non-progressors , and how do they fit into the search ? Bob Massie is a JJ - term non-progressor . His immune system 's ability to fight HIV is inspiring a JJ approach to fighting AIDS . Baltimore : There is a small group of H.I.V.- infected NNS — maybe five percent — who do n't VB any NNS and whose NN is maintained at a very low level . If we MD find out the secret behind that , maybe we MD replicate it in a NN . So far we have n't VBN the secret , but there are good correlations . These NNS have a good cytotoxic T lymphocyte response , they have a good helper T cell response . [ Cytotoxic T lymphocytes , otherwise VBN as CTLs or CD8 killer T - cells , are cells involved in immune defense that can kill other cells infected by viruses . So - called CD4 helper T cells are essential for triggering antibody production , activating CTLs , and initiating other immune responses . ] So that VBZ if we can make those a focus of activity , maybe we can design a NN around those principles . But there 's no certainty that those are the key issues . There is a balance of three things : whether the NN that those NNS have is different than the NN other NNS have ; whether their immune system is somehow responding to it differently than other NNS 's immune systems are ; and whether their genetics are different . Are they inherently able to fight the NN ? Or is it something that 's learned and that therefore we MD teach other NNS to do ? text: A JJ trial has begun in Victoria this week to evaluate a potential NN against NNP - CD . The NN is called NVX - CoV2373 and is from a US biotech NN , Novavax . The trial will be carried out across Melbourne and Brisbane , and is the JJ JJ trial of a NN specifically for NNP - CD to take place in Australia . This NN is actually based on a NN that was already in development for influenza . But how might it work against NNP - CoV - 2 , the NN that causes NN - CD ? Read more : MD BCG , a 100 - NN - old NN for tuberculosis , protect against NN ? NNS trigger an immune response by introducing the cells of our immune system to a NN in a safe NN , without any exposure to the pathogen itself . All NNS have to do CD things . The JJ is make our immune cells bind to and “ eat up ” the NN . The second is to activate these immune cells so they ’re prepared to fight the current and any subsequent threats from the NN in question . We often add molecules called adjuvants to NNS to deliver a danger signal to the immune system , activate immune cells and trigger a strong immune response . Read more : Revealed : the protein ' spike ' that lets the 2019 - nCoV NN pierce and invade JJ cells The Novavax NN is what we call a “ subunit ” NN because , instead of delivering the whole NN , it delivers only part of it . The element of NNP - CoV - 2 in this NN is the spike protein , which is VBN on the NN of the NN . By targeting a particular protein , a subunit NN is a great NN to focus the immune response . However , protein by itself is not very good at binding to and activating the cells of our immune system . Proteins are generally soluble , which does n’t appeal to immune cells . They VBP something they can chew on . So instead of soluble protein , Novavax has assembled the NNP - CoV - 2 spike protein into very small particles , called nanoparticles . To immune cells , these nanoparticles look IN little viruses , so immune cells can bind to these pre-packaged chunks of protein , rapidly engulfing them and becoming activated . The Novavax NN RB contains an adjuvant called Matrix - M. While the nanoparticles deliver a modest danger signal , Matrix - M can be added to deliver a much stronger danger signal and really wake up the immune system . The Novavax NN for NNP - CoV - 2 is based on a NN the NN was already developing for influenza , called NanoFlu . The NanoFlu NN contains similar parts – nanoparticles with the Matrix - M adjuvant . But it uses a different protein in the nanoparticle ( hemagglutinin , which is on the outside of the influenza NN ) . In October last NN , Novavax started testing NanoFlu in a phase III clinical trial , the last level of clinical testing before a NN can be licensed . This trial had 2,650 volunteers and researchers were comparing whether NanoFlu performed as well as Fluzone , a standard influenza NN . Read more : Where are we at with developing a NN for NN ? An important feature of this trial is participants were over the age of 65 . Older NNS tend to have poorer responses to NNS , because immune cells become more difficult to activate as we age . This trial is ongoing , with volunteers to be followed until the end of the NN . However , early results suggest NanoFlu can generate significantly higher levels of antibodies than Fluzone – RB given the older NNS in the trial . Antibodies are small proteins made by our immune cells which bind strongly to viruses and can stop them from infecting cells in the nose and lungs . So increased antibodies with NanoFlu should result in lower rates of infection with influenza . These results were similar to those released after the phase I trial of NanoFlu , and suggest NanoFlu MD be the superior NN for influenza . So the big question is – will the same strategy work for NNP - CoV -2 ? The JJ phase I / II trial will enrol around 131 healthy volunteers aged between 18 and 59 to assess the NN ’s safety and measure how it affects the NN ’s immune response . Some volunteers will not receive the NN , as a placebo NN . The rest will receive the NN , in a few different forms . The trial will test CD doses of protein nanoparticles – a low ( 5 microgram ) or a high ( 25 microgram ) dose . Both doses will be delivered with Matrix - M adjuvant but the higher dose will RB be tested without Matrix -M . All groups will receive CD shots of the NN 21 days apart , except CD group that will just VB CD shot . This design enables researchers to ask four important questions : • None can the NN induce an immune response ? • None if so , what dose of nanoparticle is best ? • None do you need adjuvant or are nanoparticles enough ? • None do you need CD shots or is CD enough ? Read more : NN anti-vaxxers are n’t a huge threat yet . How do we keep it that NN ? While it ’s not yet clear how the NN will perform for NNP - CoV - 2 , Novavax has reported it generated strong immune responses in animals . And we VBP NanoFlu performed well and had a good safety profile for influenza . NanoFlu RB seemed to work well in older adults , which MD be essential for a NN for NN - CD . We eagerly await the JJ set of results , expected in a couple of months – an impressive turnaround NN for a clinical trial . If this initial NN is successful , the phase II portion of the trial will begin , with more participants . The Novavax NN joins at least nine other NN candidates for NNP - CoV - 2 currently in clinical testing around the NN .

text: James Jeffrey " Jeff " Bradstreet ( July 6 , 1954 – June CD , 2015 ) , was an American NN , alternative medicine practitioner , and a former preacher [ 2 ] who ran the International NNP Development Resource Center in Melbourne , Florida , [ 3 ] a medical practice in Buford , Georgia [ 4 ] and in Arizona , where he practiced homeopathy . [ 5 ] [ 6 ] He RB founded the Good NNP NNP Foundation , which aimed to combine Christian beliefs with his medical practice . [ 7 ] Bradstreet obtained a Florida medical license in 1984 . He received a Bachelor of NNP degree from the NNP of South Florida in 1976 , where he RB went to medical school beginning three NNS later . His postgraduate NN focused on aerospace medicine , and he received his training in this field from Wilford Hall Medical Center . He was an adjunct professor of NN development and neuroscience at the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine in Tempe , Arizona . [ 8 ] Bradstreet published NN NN , which he claimed indicated NNS as a NN , in the Journal of American Physicians and Surgeons , which is not indexed by PubMed . This NN claimed that autistic NNS had a higher NN burden of mercury , [ 9 ] and that three autistic NNS had NNS RNA in their cerebrospinal fluid . [ 10 ] The Institute of Medicine has rejected any relationship between NNS and NN . [ 11 ] Bradstreet treated an autistic NN named Colten Snyder ( CD of the test NNS in the NN omnibus trial ) with chelation therapy on the premise of removing mercury from his NN , in spite of the fact that hair , NN , and urine tests had failed to show he exhibited abnormal levels of mercury . [ 12 ] Over an eight - NN period , Colten visited Bradstreet 's office 160 times . [ 13 ] Stephen Barrett has stated , " It appears to me that Bradstreet decides which of his nonstandard theories to apply and records diagnoses that embody them , " and describes Bradstreet 's mercury provoked tests as " phony " . [ 12 ] Peter Hotez characterized Bradstreet 's proposal to treat NN with chelation therapy as " dangerous . " [ 6 ] In an interview with the Chicago Tribune , Bradstreet defended the use of intravenous immunoglobulin ( IVIG ) as an NN NN , saying , " Every kid with NN should have a trial of IVIG if money was not an option and IVIG was abundant . " [ 14 ] Bradstreet RB published NN regarding the use of hyperbaric oxygen therapy for NN , [ 15 ] some of which concluded it was ineffective , [ 16 ] as well as a paper arguing that autistic NNS have an increased vulnerability to oxidative stress . [ 17 ] Further treatments Bradstreet used on autistic NNS included the controversial protein GcMAF , with which he claimed to have treated 600 NNS . [ 18 ] In an article for an anti-vaccine magazine , Bradstreet endorsed stem cell therapy as an NN NN . [ CD ] Bradstreet was VBN dead from a gunshot wound to the chest in the Broad River in Rutherford County , North Carolina in June 2015 , after his Buford , Georgia medical office was raided by the FDA in connection with an investigation into GcMAF treatments . [ 4] [ 20 ] [ 21 ] At the NN of his death , he lived in Braselton and ran his medical practice in Buford . [ 4 ] While the police ruled Bradstreet 's death a suicide , several family members and anti-vaccine activists claimed he was murdered in connection with his criticism of NNS . [ 22 ] Bradstreet 's son is autistic , which Bradstreet attributed to a NN his son received at age 15 months . text: NN NNS have spread across the US this NN , with the NN of NNP York now facing its worst outbreak in decades . Since last autumn , more than 150 NNS have been recorded in Rockland County , a NNP York suburb home to a JJ ultra-Orthodox Jewish community where there has been some resistance to vaccinations . The vast majority of US NNS allow families to opt out of getting vaccinated if they object on religious grounds and parents seem to take advantage of these rules . Researchers have VBN that broad philosophical and religious exemptions to NN requirements are associated with higher rates of unvaccinated NNS . But this NN ’s outbreaks are now raising public NN questions about why NNS allow such exemptions . Here is how religious exemptions work : What is a religious exemption to a NN , and which US NNPS have them ? Religious exemptions allow parents to opt their NNS out of mandated NN policies if they object to the NN for religious reasons and if they follow the NN ’s opt - out process . Almost every NN , plus Washington DC , allows for a religious exemption beginning at least in kindergarten . Four NNS do not : California , West Virginia , Mississippi and Arizona . Each NN has its own rules regarding vaccinations for NNS who attend public schools . In addition to the religious exemption , all 50 NNS , plus Washington DC , allow exceptions for medical reasons . Examples include a NN who has a condition IN cancer or an immune disorder where a NN MD be harmful to the NN ’s NN . And more than a dozen NNS offer philosophical exemptions , sometimes VBN as personal - belief exemptions , which do not require that a parent ’s desire to opt out be specifically about their religious beliefs . Instead , they can include exemptions for conscience or moral ideology . California , West Virginia and Mississippi , which do not allow religious exemptions , RB do not allow philosophical objections . How are religious exemptions connected to the recent US NNS outbreak ? The NNS outbreak in the NNP York suburb of Rockland County has largely been cantered in an ultra-Orthodox Jewish community , where there has been some recent resistance to vaccinations . NN rates tend to be low among the ultra-Orthodox , and the reasons vary , from fear of interference from outsiders to confusion over accurate religious and medical NN . The current flare - up in NNP York and NNP Jersey , both of which allow religious exemptions , can be traced RB to the NN outbreaks in Israel last NN . Because ultra-Orthodox parents often send their NNS to their own religious schools , the outbreak was initially largely contained . But it has recently spread significantly . Some Orthodox Jewish schools have been allowing unvaccinated NNS to attend school , against the NNP York NNP Department ’s mandate , during the NN outbreak . How are NNS a religious issue for some NNS ? Some NNS worry that vaccinating interrupts a divine plan for someone ’s NN , and they do not VB to interfere in NNP ’s will . Others have concerns that some NNS MD violate religious dietary laws , unless they are designated kosher or halal . Last NN an influential Islamic group in Indonesia issued a controversial fatwa , which was later overturned , against the NNS - mumps - rubella , or MMR , NN , citing its use of porcine gelatin . And JJ of those who oppose abortion object to certain NNS , IN those designed to prevent chickenpox or hepatitis A . Those NNS are made by growing viruses in fetal embryo fibroblast cells , or cell lines that are grown in laboratories but are derived from CD elective abortions in the 1960s . A Catholic family in Kentucky , for example , has filed a lawsuit against the Northern Kentucky NNP Department for banning unvaccinated students from school and athletics during a chickenpox outbreak at their son ’s Catholic school . Are the recent NNS outbreaks causing some US NNS to reconsider exemptions ? To an extent , yes . NN exemptions for NNS enrolled in kindergarten have slowly grown over the past decade , according to the Centres for NNP NNP and Prevention ( CDC ) , prompting some NNS to consider NNS . California got rid of its non-medical exemptions in 2015 . A few NNS that allow religious exemptions have made them more difficult to VB , requiring things IN a signed affidavit from a religious leader instead of simply filling out an online form . NN lawmakers , often Republicans , around the country introduced more than 150 bills from 2011 through 2017 that MD have made it easier to obtain exemptions from NN policies . But according to a NN in the American Journal of Public NNP published in January , the 13 bills signed into law actually limited the ability to exempt . Some professional organisations have RB taken action . The American Association of Pediatrics has made the elimination of non-medical NN exemptions its top priority this NN , RB ranking it above family separations at the border . Are religious leaders doing anything to address the issue ? Yes . Rabbis and doctors organised a public NN NN to stress the importance of NNS . The Orthodox Union and the Rabbinal Council of America have strongly urged parents to vaccinate their NNS . “ It is well VBN that those facing RB a potential NN - or - death situation are instructed to set aside the Sabbath and other key tenets of halachic ( Jewish law ) observance until the emergency has passed , ” they VBD in November . Elsewhere , local NN and community leaders have stressed open communication between NN officials and religious leaders to bridge cultural divides . In Colorado , Dr Joshua Williams , an assistant professor of pediatrics at the NNP of Colorado Denver School of Medicine , has recommended that the groups talk at specific times , such as when the academic NN begins or at the start of influenza season , and not just during a NN crisis . He is RB working with the NN ’s Council of Churches to hold sessions with parishioners to hear their concerns . “ Religious vaccinations exemptions impact public NN , ” Dr Williams VBD . “ There is a need to dialogue with religious leaders around NN exemptions at local and national levels . ”

text: Recent trends in NNP - CD data appear to show little signs of slowing , as a number of NNS continued to report a rise in JJ NNS and hospitalizations . text: Legendary gold and market expert Jim Sinclair VBZ the NN that originated in China MD have , oddly enough , done some good . Sinclair explains , “ The effect of the NN was literally to shut down business globally , therefore , shut off the demand for loans , which RB shut off demand for short term money . So , what the public has not seen , is not considering and does not understand is we were stepping into the door of a major financial crisis magnitudes larger than what happened in 2008 and 2009 . It ’s a horrible thing that this NN occurred , but if it had not occurred , we MD have been in a crisis much more serious than 2008 and 2009 . . . . It was blowing sky high . . . . Shutting down demand is all we MD do . It stopped the explosion of interest rates . ” Where do we VB from here ? Sinclair VBZ , “ We are VBG to make a recovery . It ’s not VBG to be a ‘ V ’ by any means . The stock market MD be a ‘ V ’ because the stock market has very little to do with reality . . . . As far as business is concerned , very serious damage has been done to the infrastructure to the business equation . JJ employers are gone . JJ corporations have significant readjustments to be able to build up again . The supply lines and logistics , where did everything come from ? China . . . . This is a major worldwide adjustment , both economically and politically . . . . We had everything made in the cheapest place possible . . . . This is not a passing phenomenon . . . . The only thing that has been steady is gold . . . . The NN that this brings about is a reconstruction of the basic business foundations . It ’s a start over , it ’s not just a slowdown . How JJ restaurants make money on 50 % of the clients ? You can ’t . How JJ automobiles have built up on the lots ? Enormous amounts . How JJ clothing stores shut down full of winter clothes and ca n’t make the shift to summer wear ? You can VB down the entire line . So , this recovery will be more IN an ‘ L ’ . We ’ve come straight down , and we are VBG to VB sideways now . . . . JJ businesses are not VBG to open up again . . . . The idea of the coming inflation as a result of this is simple . Everything that you need will VB up in price . Everything you do n’t need is not VBG to hold value . You are better off with a freezer full of fine cuts of beef than you are with a brand JJ Tesla . The beef will VB up in price , the Tesla will VB down . ” On gold , Sinclair VBZ the ultimate price is an easy - to - calculate math problem . How much gold does America have compared to how much debt it has ? So , how high MD gold ultimately VB ? Sinclair VBZ , “ It ’s simple math . You take the amount of gold the U.S. VBZ it has , and then you take the debt it has , and what price MD you need for the debt to balance to zero ? The price on the low end is $ 50,000 per ounce . The true price is $ 87,500 per ounce . ” Is a biblical debt jubilee coming to America ? Sinclair VBZ , “ We already have jubilees . If you do n’t pay your rent , you have a jubilee . If you do n’t pay your student loan , you have a jubilee . If the payment of your auto insurance is postponed , you have a jubilee . We ’ve got jubilee after jubilee after jubilee . Keep in mind , CD NN ’s jubilee is another NN ’s disaster . It ’s almost as if the Bible is correct in terms of economics . RB , keep in mind , the NNS who are n’t being paid are being hurt very badly . ” Sinclair thinks the recovery will take a decade or longer , and Sinclair VBZ , “ It will be just IN the period between 1929 up to WWII ( 1941 ) . ” Join Greg Hunter as he goes CD - on - CD with renowned gold expert Jim Sinclair . Sinclair did call RB in and VBD his power was knocked out for a short while . He RB added , “ I will give the re-election of NNP NNP a 50/50 chance . NNP knows what he has to do , and that is bring the economy RB . If he does that , Trumps re-election will be a slam dunk . If NNP is not re-elected , the game board breaks . ” If you VBP to VB about Sinclair ’s NN that he talked about and NN that gold is finally being brought up out of the ground , VB to TanGoldCorp.com .
