text: The NNS outbreaks continue to spread , with NNP York City declaring a public NN emergency and requiring NNS in four ZIP codes to have their NNS vaccinated or face penalties , including a fine of US $ 1,000 and or imprisonment . Since September 2018 , 285 NN NNS have been reported in Brooklyn and Queens , mainly in neighborhoods where ultra-Orthodox Jews have chosen to not have their NNS vaccinated . The Centers for NNP NNP and Prevention , VBD that from Jan. 1 to April 4 , 2019 , 465 individual NNS of NNS have been confirmed in CD NNS . This is the second - highest number of NNS since the CDC declared NNS eliminated in 2000 ; in 2014 , 667 NNS occurred . NNS have still been occurring each NN , often brought into the NNP NNPS from international travelers . Officials VBP that to be the NN of the outbreak in Rockland County , NNP York , where 168 NNS were reported as of April 8 , 2019 . Rockland public NN officials issued a ban that MD keep unvaccinated NNS out of public places , but a judge overruled that on April 5 . On April 9 , county officials VBD they MD appeal . But there are limits to what NN care providers , public NN officials and legislators can do . It is crucial to consider both the power – and the limits – of potential solutions that will provide education , medical care and protection for the public while still upholding principles of informed consent , parental decision - making and sustaining public trust . As a professor who researches and teaches NN law , public NN law and medical ethics , I VBP it ’s worth clarifying what NNS can or cannot legally do when responding to NNS of communicable NN . The law recognizes the NN of an individual to refuse medical interventions . NN law has a strong history of recognizing bodily integrity : Adults can choose whether to accept or reject a proposed medical intervention , RB in instances where public NN authorities conclude a NN MD benefit both the individual and society . The Supreme Court has recognized parents ’ ability to direct the care and NN of their NNS , including consenting or forgoing medical NN for their NN except in very specific circumstances . In the 1905 Jacobson v. Massachusetts case , the Supreme Court upheld a NN law delegating power to local NN officials mandating that adults receive CD smallpox NN in the midst of an epidemic or pay a fine ( about $ 130 today ) . Under the concept of police power , NNS have a duty to enact laws that promote the NN , safety and welfare of its residents . Public NN authorities MD offer NNS as a method of prevention , but medical professionals , public NN authorities and RB courts MD not legally compel a person to submit to a NN . The Jacobson decision RB set forth limits on police power , yet subsequent NNS addressing NN mandates discarded these requirements , extending multiple NN mandates to school attendance for NN not in circulation and in the absence of an epidemic . Deferring to respected scientific consensus as a means to justify forced medical interventions in the name of individual benefit and the public good has historically resulted in some of the most egregious constitutional and JJ rights atrocities in the U.S . The mass forcible sterilization during the eugenics movement is but CD example . The history of NN and medicine further demonstrates the fallibility of commonly accepted medical knowledge , such as when Bayer introduced heroin as a safe , non-addictive substitute for morphine , or physicians prescribed Bendectin and thalidomide to relieve nausea , only to find these medications resulted in babies born with severe birth defects . The law is RB quite clear that public NN authorities and law enforcement MD place restrictions on a person ’s individual liberty – including religious liberty – in situations where a person ’s actions pose a direct , immediate and compelling harm to others , such as using venomous snakes in religious worship or asserting a nonexistent “ NN ” to use an illegal substance such as marijuana when operating a motor vehicle . In public NN law relating to communicable NN , this constitutes a very specific standard : A person must have a present NN , and this person ’s actions must pose a direct threat to others . For example , NN officials MD seek a quarantine order or civil commitment for a person with active tuberculosis who continues to frequent highly populated public spaces until the person is no longer contagious . RB in such a case , NN authorities can offer NN and limit a person ’s movement to prevent infecting others , but the law does not permit forcibly medicating a competent person against his will . Accordingly , legal precedent does not support quarantining vast geographic areas of healthy persons who have not been exposed to the communicable illness , but MD support tailored voluntary isolation and quarantine of persons who have been exposed to , or currently have , the illness . What NN officials can do to protect NNS The CDC classifies NNS as CD of the top 10 public NN achievements . The vast majority ( about 98 % ) of parents across the U.S. as a whole comply with the NN law mandated schedule of NNS for their NNS . NNS , IN any other FDA - approved product such as a prescription drug or medical device , carry a set of risks and benefits . These calculations vary depending on the NN , its efficacy , safety , potential side effects , the severity of the illness the NN aims to protect against , and the individual to whom it is administered . NN NN and practice similarly evolved with historical mistakes ( the Cutter incident ) and ongoing disputes about risks and benefits for individual NNS IN NN and anthrax . To promote NN for NNS , NN officials MD offer educational campaigns and set up free clinics for parents to bring their NNS . NN laws MD RB mandate NNS as a condition for school attendance , or require excluding unvaccinated NNS during an active outbreak at their school . However , if NNS offer a religious or nonmedical exemption , courts have been clear that NN officials and school officials do not have discretion to require the NN ’s parent to identify with an organized religion or reject the sincerity of the parent ’s beliefs because this violates the NNP Amendment . Public NN professionals worry that parents who forgo NN are placing their NN and the community at NN . Some have advocated that the NN should step in with coercive measures such as eliminating any nonmedical exemptions for all NNS or intervene by force , such as classifying parents ’ decision as NN neglect or seeking a court order to vaccinate the NN . In my opinion , these strategies rely on a distortion of legal precedent , dismiss longstanding authority of parents to make decisions for their NNS , and threaten to undermine an already fractured public trust . NNS that uphold NN intervention to protect a NN by compelling medical NN generally require that the NN has an illness , the illness is severe and NN - threatening , and the risks and benefits of intervening are assessed . This requires medical professionals and NN officials to maintain precision in distinguishing whether the parents are deciding to forgo recommended NNS , or whether they are refusing medical care for a critically ill NN . Indeed , a recent case in Chandler , Arizona , demonstrated how a NN of coercion and force MD result in parental fear and refusal to constructively engage with NN officials for RB an ill NN . NN public NN officials have the duty to protect residents from illness and communicable NN , but these strategies must fall within appropriate legal parameters . Dismissing these legal boundaries or justifying unnecessary force not only undermines fundamental liberties , but in my view fuels parental and community distrust of NN officials and sets RB the ultimate goals of protecting the public .

text: A teenager who made headlines for getting vaccinated despite his family 's wishes has testified about his experience to US lawmakers . Ethan Lindenberger , from Ohio , sought immunisations aged 18 after turning to the internet for advice . Federal data suggests the proportion of US NNS under CD not being immunised has quadrupled since 2001 . Doctors at the hearing blamed online misinformation and discredited NN for scaring parents away from NNS . Mr Lindenberger , who is still a senior in high school , spoke on Tuesday at the Senate Committee on NNP , Education , Labor and Pensions alongside four doctors who are experts in the field . He VBD much of his mother 's opposition to routine NNS came from fear they MD VB side - effects IN brain damage or NN . text: Be the JJ to VB about every JJ NNP NN With JJ NN horizons , complex NN and high failure rates , NN development is not for the faint - hearted philanthropist . But in a NN gripped by NN , JJ donors have put aside such concerns and are writing JJ cheques in the hope of contributing to the end of the NN . Alibaba founder Jack Ma has promised more than $ 14 m for NN NN , while the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation has pledged up to $ 100 m to the JJ response to NNP - CD , including funding to accelerate the development of NNS . RB the Gates Foundation ’s move pales in comparison with the funds now being committed by governments and pharmaceutical NNS . In the US alone , the National Institutes of NNP , the federal NN centres , have secured $ 1.8bn in additional NN funding for NNP - CD work , including NN investigations . Meanwhile the American drugs group Johnson & Johnson is putting $ 1bn into developing a specific NN NN , in a project jointly funded by the US NN . But charitable dollars can still play a crucial role . Philanthropy advisors say donors are free from the burdens of politics that often hamper policymakers and from the profits drive that influences NNS ( RB if , as with J&J ’s NNP - CD NN , executives claim a particular move is profit - free ) . This can allow philanthropists to VB very JJ term NN and bring together disparate groups of partners , including universities , NN laboratories and other donors . “ We can fund longer timelines than NN or industry , ” VBZ Heather Youngs , programme officer for scientific NN at Open Philanthropy , a NN and grant - making organisation . “ They have constraints because of the stakeholder groups they have to answer to , whether voters or shareholders . So philanthropy can fill in the gaps . ” An example is Open Philanthropy , where the main funders are Cari Tuna and her husband and NNP co-founder Dustin Moskovitz . The foundation makes grants to NN NN centres globally , such as a 2017 award of more than $ 11 m to support NN at the NNP of Washington ’s Institute for Protein Design for the development a universal influenza NN . Philanthropy is particularly important in NN development because drug NNS find it hard to achieve a financial return on the JJ , JJ - term investments needed . “ You VBP these glaring market failures , JJ of them in the NN NN , ” VBZ Mark Suzman , chief executive of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation , which since inception has committed more than $ 18bn to the discovery , development and delivery of NNS . Suzman cites malaria , which despite being responsible for hundreds of thousands of deaths a NN , still has no effective NN . “ We do n’t have malaria problems in rich NNS because we have effective prophylaxis : if you visit a malarial zone , you can take pills and you wo n’t VB the NN , ” he VBZ . “ So there is n’t an incentive for the private sector to put in the billions of dollars that are needed to underwrite a JJ NN . ” And while JJ pharmaceutical groups were successful in developing an Ebola NN , the market — limited largely to a few African NNS — was not JJ enough for them to recover their costs . “ In the end they are businesses , and some of them got quite burnt by that , ” VBZ Suzman . When NNS do invest , it tends to be in the later stages of NN development , VBZ Melissa Stevens , executive director of the Milken Institute Center for Strategic Philanthropy , which advises families , foundations and individual philanthropists . Charitable dollars can play a critical role in closing the gap between the original NN project and delivering a NN to the public , perhaps 10 - 15 NNS later . Donors fund the earlier , riskier stages in the journey of NNS from academia , NN labs and entrepreneurial biotech firms to pre-clinical trials and ensuring they meet the regulatory standards needed to enter clinical trials . “ That ’s where philanthropy can have an outsized impact , ” VBZ Stevens . British philanthropist Richard Ross agrees . He chairs Rosetrees Trust , a fund specialising in medical NN established by his late entrepreneur parents , which has distributed nearly £ 50 m since its foundation in 1987 . “ A lot of [ early NN ] is basic NN , which can be 30 NNS away from practical application in medicine , ” he VBZ . “ NNS come and say I ca n’t VB grant money because I have no data . We can make a difference with CD NN ’s money or three NNS ’ money . That ’s an entrepreneurial approach . ” Rosetrees , which has set aside money for NNP - CD NN , is considering about 10 projects , including CD involving a drug used for brain tumours and another an existing tuberculosis NN . Philanthropists can RB fund NN - linked education . “ You VBP a growing anti-vaccination movement based in ignorance , ” VBZ Amir Pasic , dean of Indiana NNP ’s Lilly Family School of Philanthropy . “ You ca n’t overestimate the importance of education , and I VBP we ’ll VB more of that . ” While philanthropists financed NN NN RB before NNP - CD came along , the NN has sparked a wave of interest among potential JJ donors . Eric Kessler , founder , principal and senior managing director at Arabella Advisors , a US - based philanthropic consultancy , VBZ : “ Donors who have historically focused on JJ NN are tripling down RB now , and JJ donors who ’ve never focused on JJ NN are getting into the fray for the JJ NN . It ’s hard to VB how much is VBG specifically into NN NN , but we can say it ’s significant . ” Kasey Oliver , a director in the consulting practice at philanthropic advisory NN Geneva NNP , VBZ that as well as reacting to an event such as the NNP - CD NN , donors can be motivated by anything from wanting to VB eradicate a NN that has killed a family member to wishing to bet on something that MD bring JJ - term NN . However , participating in NN NN as a philanthropist is not easy . RB , it involves complex and emerging NN and so means relying on experts . “ You need to be willing and able to be flexible and a little hands - off , ” VBZ Stevens . “ And not everyone goes into their philanthropy with that type of mindset . ” And because it requires the involvement of the private sector , particularly in manufacturing and distribution , donors MD face obstacles in ensuring that any successful NN can be sold cheaply enough to benefit poor communities . To address this , in 2003 the Gates Foundation developed its JJ Access model for grant contracts . This stipulates that NNS or universities that receive its funding must make the resulting treatments widely available at affordable prices . They are RB required to share data . Another challenge for individual philanthropists without the resources of billionaire donors is the sheer amount of money required for NN development . This was among the reasons behind a JJ collaborative fund , which was launched in January to accelerate the development of NNS against emerging diseases . With an initial investment of $ 460 m from the German , Japanese and Norwegian governments , the Gates Foundation and the UK ’s Wellcome Trust , the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations acts as a hub to which any philanthropist can contribute . The group has issued an urgent call for $ 2bn to develop a NNP - CD NN . Another NN for a philanthropist with less money than Gates to VB is to create a prize to stimulate academic competition . American philanthropists Gary and Alya Michelson have done just that through the Michelson Prizes . Their annual awards VBP to young NNS — each winner receiving $ 150,000 — who are working in JJ ways on JJ immunology , NN discovery , and immunotherapy NN in major JJ diseases . At least with prizes , the donors ’ names can be recognised . Otherwise , unlike with gifts to an opera house or NN building , or RB the endowment of an academic post or a scholarship , it is hard to attach a donor ’s name to JJ - term medical NN . “ Does this appeal to NNS who VBP their name on the wall ? No , ” VBZ Ross . Moreover , with NN projects , as with most JJ term medical NN , there is the likelihood of failure . Few donors VBP to fund a loser . But developing NNS , from the pre-clinical phase to production , typically takes more than a decade and has just a 6 per cent probability of making it to market , according to a 2013 NN led by researchers at Erasmus NNP in the Netherlands . “ The trouble with NNS is they ’re expensive , ” VBZ Peter Hotez , co-director of the Center for NNP Development at Texas NNP ’s Hospital . “ You need substantial funding and the timelines are pretty JJ — and often donors , especially the more entrepreneurial donors , VBP a more immediate return . That ’s the toughest part of this . ” But Maria Elena Bottazzi , Hotez ’s co-director , argues that RB when it results in failure , funding NN NN is extremely valuable . “ It ’s transformative , because you are at the same NN building the next generation of innovators and NNS , ” she VBZ . And , as the NN NN has demonstrated , success can have a JJ and JJ impact that is JJ . “ Where MD we be RB now if we had a NN for NNP - CD ? ” VBZ Oliver . “ NNS are game changers . text: There MD be no force on NN more powerful than the protective instincts of a parent . It can overcome almost any obstacle for good or ill – including logical thought and rational argument . The NNP Files : NNP Wars ( BBC CD ) exposed this phenomenon at its most dangerous , forensically pulling apart the anti-vaxxer movement with widely discredited concepts such as “ facts ” and “ experts ” until there was nothing left but opportunists , cranks and JJ - NN bots using it to attack Big NNP and Big Pharma . Caught in the crossfire : angry , grief - stricken mothers and fathers trying to come to terms with their son or daughter ’s condition . This was a battle of evidence against emotion , with no winners . Victoria James ’s excellent film painted a detailed picture of a NN metastasising in the NNP NNP era . She interviewed NNS from all sides of the debate , from concerned NNS and NN officials to parents and leaders of movements who allege links between childhood vaccinations and traumatic conditions such as NN . That these parents had suffered dreadfully was not disputed , but a patchwork of anecdotal tragedies MD never represent irrefutable proof . Their stance , at least , was defensible . text: Mercury from NNS seems to disappear rapidly from the NN , returning to pre-vaccination levels in CD month , according to a small NN of NNS in Argentina . The findings bolster the argument that a mercury - based NN preservative does n't VB NN in NNS , although it 's unclear from the NN whether some mercury MD linger elsewhere in the NN . The NN addresses an unanswered question about the safety of thimerosal , a preservative that has been eliminated from routine U.S. NNS , and breaks down as ethyl mercury in the NN . It is still used in other NNS , including Argentina . NNS assumed the NN risks from ethyl mercury were similar to methyl mercury from eating fish . And in 1999 , the federal NN and NN manufacturers agreed that thimerosal should be reduced or eliminated in NNS to lower exposure to mercury from all sources . The decision was based on what was VBN about methyl mercury exposure . The JJ findings suggest that methyl mercury and ethyl mercury are very different and that the removal of thimerosal from NNS MD have been over - cautious . " The NN supports the decision by the NNP NNP Organization to continue to permit thimerosal to remain in NNS for the NN 's NNS , " VBD NN co-author Dr. Michael Pichichero of the NNP of Rochester in Rochester , N.Y . He VBD thimerosal NNS are cheaper to produce and therefore more accessible to much of the NN . In the U.S. - funded NN , NN samples were taken from 216 healthy babies before and after they got NNS containing the preservative thimerosal . NN levels of mercury were highest shortly after the babies were vaccinated and fell to pre-vaccination levels within a few weeks . " The amount VBN in the NN was about CD - tenth of that predicted in that the late 1990s and the length of NN it stays in the NN is CD - tenth of that predicted , " Pichichero VBD . Mercury levels RB were measured in the babies ' stools and urine . In the stool samples , the levels were highest after NN and RB fell , but more slowly than NN levels . There was no significant amount of mercury in the urine . The authors MD not determine what happened to all the mercury after it left the NN . All the infants gave samples twice : before NN and at CD other NN , ranging from 12 hours later to 30 days . The NN will be published in the February issue of the journal Pediatrics . The medical journal released the findings early because of a controversy surrounding a JJ TV series premiering Thursday , which features a lawyer who argues in court that a NN NN made a NN autistic . The journal is published by the American Academy of Pediatrics , which on Monday called on ABC to cancel the JJ episode of the series , " Eli Stone , " saying that it perpetuates the myth that NNS can VB NN . NN is a complex disorder featuring repetitive behaviors and poor JJ interaction and communication skills . NNS generally VBP that genetics plays a role in causing the disorder ; a NN that thimerosal is to blame has been repeatedly discounted in scientific studies . text: Brain scans , analyzed using a type of artificial intelligence , can reveal whether 6 - month - old babies are likely to develop NN , a JJ NN shows . The NN examined 59 infants who were at high NN of developing NN ; that is , each had an older sibling with NN . The results of the JJ NN MD lead to JJ diagnostic tools that identify NN before NNS occur , giving clinicians the opportunity to intervene early , the researchers VBD . " The idea is that we can be more effective if we can VB to these kids before they develop NN , perhaps ameliorating or preventing it , " Dr. Joseph Piven , a professor of psychiatry at the UNC School of Medicine and director of the Carolina Institute for Developmental Disabilities , VBD Live NNP . The researchers published their results today ( June 7 ) in the journal NNP Translational Medicine . NN spectrum disorder , a brain - based disorder characterized by a wide range of JJ - communication challenges and repetitive behaviors , affects about CD out of every 68 NNS in the NNP NNPS . Behavioral NNS typically begin to appear in NNS at around age 2 . Emerson and his colleagues demonstrated that they MD identify biomarkers for the disorder before the NNS occur . As part of their NN , the researchers used MRI scanners to image the brains of the infants while they slept . During the scans , the researchers recorded the neural activity of 230 different regions in the brain , looking particularly at whether or not pairs of these region — referred to as functional connections — were synchronized with each other , and if so , to what extent . They wanted to VB how accurately it MD predict which infants had developed NN , using only the functional connections data from when the NNS were 6 months old . Machine learning is a kind of artificial intelligence system that gets smarter based on the data it processes . In this case , the program was learning to spot differences between the functional connections imaged in the MRI data collected at 6 months old that correlate with cognition , memory and behavior and the details from the behavioral assessments collected at 24 months . text: Thursday ’s NNP Malaria Day arrived with some good NN stories : the JJ - scale launch of a pioneering NN in Malawi is just CD promising fresh approach to tackling the NN . Others include the introduction of better bednets , insecticides and diagnostics , JJ drugs to respond to the continuing threat of resistance and the potential through “ gene - drive ” technology to wipe out the mosquito that transmits the parasite between humans . There has been some progress towards ending the NN among the 21 NNS targeted for its elimination by next NN . Yet the trend is less impressive in some of the highest burden NNS such as Nigeria and there is backsliding elsewhere , notably in Venezuela , where NN failures are undermining the NN system and imposing a heavy JJ burden . Much work still needs to be done to improve the data on malaria ’s impact , notably to VB NNS focus their resources . But it is clear that JJ progress has stagnated , with around 200 m annual NNS and at least 430,000 deaths imposing a heavy JJ and financial toll . There is limited potential or appetite for private sector funding mechanisms and in the build - up to “ replenishment ” fundraisings for international funding agencies this NN , the monies invested remain far below the levels estimated to be necessary to tackle the NN . Listen to the podcast : Gene - drive technology and the fight against malaria Register here to VB FT NNP by email for free each Friday Abdourahmane Diallo , former NN minister of Guinea and newly appointed chief executive of the Roll NNP Malaria Partnership . What is your interest in malaria ? I ’m originally from Guinea and I MD n’t say how JJ times I ’ve had malaria since I was a NN . I ’m a medical NN by training and had an international public NN career focused on developing NNS . I worked for [ US consultancy ] JSI and the US NNP ’s Malaria Initiative . I became minister of NN in 2016 and when I finished I wanted to VB RB into public NN and VB tackle a NN with a JJ dimension . What are your priorities at RBM ? We are at a critical phase in the fight against malaria . With the JJ Fund to Fight Aids , TB and Malaria replenishment this NN , we will step up the fight . My priority is to really call on all governments to play their part . To make the biggest difference , we need to VB the highest malaria - burden NNS VBP RB on track through four key responses : political will , strategic data to drive impact , better guidance on up - to - date scientifically proven approaches , and a co-ordinated response . What is the likelihood of ending malaria ? We VBP it is possible to end malaria within our lifetime . But there has to be a JJ collective effort from all angles with all stakeholders to make it happen . Our theme is “ malaria starts with me ” . We are calling on pretty much everyone to contribute : political leaders to maintain their commitment to funding ; the private sector ; and the citizens of every country to play their part themselves , by teaching others and holding their political leaders accountable . Budgeting for NN JJ official data breaks down UK NN spending by financing mechanism , function , and provider organisation . NN expenditure accounted for 79 per cent of the 2017 total , a proportion little changed since 2013 . ( ONS ) NN fears grow NN immunisation week celebrated NN successes but RB noted the damage from misinformation in places IN the Democratic Republic of Congo where the Ebola outbreak is spiralling . NNP WHO and Unicef analysis VBD more than 20 m NNS went unvaccinated each NN over the past eight NNS , leaving 170 m under - 10s currently without protection . The top high - income NNS where NNS did not receive a JJ NN dose are the US — which this week hit record levels of NNS since it was eliminated in 2000 — followed by France , UK , Argentina and Italy . ( VoA , Guardian , Washington Post , Unicef ) Antibiotics alert A biotech bankruptcy illustrated the disaster in the antibiotics market , VBD the Wellcome Trust chief : there is no viable route to market for JJ drugs , however valuable they MD be to society . CD possible route is switching to “ pull ” incentives which reward R&D done well . ( FT , Wired ) Sexual NN The US came under fire for having references to sexual and reproductive NN removed from a UN resolution on sexual violence . British MPs hit out at anomalies in abortion rights in Northern Ireland . ( BBC , UK parliament ) Frontline dilemmas Better guidance and training are needed for humanitarian workers in conflict zones faced with difficult ethical decisions . When a hospital is bombed , is it better to rebuild at the same location or move to a safer area but CD which MD make access for locals more difficult ? ( Johns Hopkins Center for Humanitarian NNP ) Drugs by drone The NN 's largest drone delivery network is bringing medicines , NNS and NN to 2,000 clinics in Ghana . NN workers will receive deliveries via a parachute drop within about 30 minutes of placing their orders by text message . ( FT ) Food for thought The WHO called for industrially produced trans fats to be replaced by healthier fats and oils and eliminated from processed foods completely by 2023 . Some UK campaigners highlighted the limited powers of local authorities to restrict advertising on unhealthy foods while others called for a JJ watchdog to tackle NNS ’s food insecurity . The FT VBD meat needed to justify its presence on dining tables in the face of concerns over JJ NN , animal welfare and the environment . ( WHO , Guardian , Food Foundation , FT ) Indian NN Healthcare is yet to become a major issue in the Indian general election despite serious problems such as out - of - pocket medical expenses causing great hardship . A dedicated LGBT clinic in Mumbai offers some respite from the discrimination experienced at JJ NN facilities . ( The Wire , Guardian ) Keeping active Some 23 per cent of adults and 80 per cent of adolescents are not sufficiently physically active and VBP diseases such as obesity . The WHO 's JJ guidelines for NNS 's physical activity include recommendations on screen NN . Some experts doubted the report ’s evidence base . A separate NN showed Americans becoming increasingly sedentary . ( WHO , Guardian , Jama ) Millennial malaise A RB - running US survey VBD millennials ( those born between 1981 and 1996 ) were less healthy than their Generation X predecessors at the same age . The trend MD have serious effects on the US economy over the next 20 NNS including on workplace productivity and healthcare costs . ( Blue Cross Blue Shield ) Opioids crisis The US NN filed the JJ criminal charges against a drug distributor for allegedly fuelling the country 's opioid epidemic . NNP NNP vowed to continue the fight to the finish . ( Reuters ) Big Pharma bets big As patents rise and shareholder pressure leads to cuts in R&D , Big Pharma has been buying smaller NNS to fill their drug pipelines . Will the gamble be worth it ? AstraZeneca boss Pascal Soriot reflects on Pfizer 's attempted takeover of his NN . ( FT NN , FT ) Dentistry doubts “ We have a fraught relationship with dentists as authority figures , ” argues a JJ analysis by The Atlantic . The profession lacks the same level of scientific scrutiny as medicine , it VBZ , often leading to gratuitous procedures . Dentists are however ideally placed to VB detect diabetes and cardiovascular NN . ( The Atlantic , BMJ ) NN or scare ? A BBC series aims to separate medical NN from fiction . ( BBC iPlayer ) Best from the journals Investing in adolescent NN More NNS and adolescents than ever before are exposed to risks of diseases from factors such as tobacco and alcohol use , processed foods and reduced physical activity . Early intervention MD bring high returns on investment and reduce the NN of premature deaths . ( BMJ ) NN emergencies Half the NN 's deaths come from medical emergencies , such as accidents , falls and burns ( 22 per cent ) ; heart attacks ( 17 per cent ) ; lung infections ( 11 per cent ) ; and strokes ( 7 per cent ) , with a much higher incidence in poorer NNS . Improvement MD come through strengthening healthcare , transport , training and communication systems . ( BMJ ) Medical misinformation Medical journals have an important role to play in galvanising and co-ordinating the response from the NN community to medical misinformation . ( Jama ) Transgender NN The NN of how CD NN built the largest NN of transgender NNS in the NN : The European Network for the Investigation of Gender Incongruence . ( Nature ) A hidden NN Thousands of non-smokers die from lung cancer thanks to air pollution and other carcinogens but the condition is still viewed as a “ smoker ’s NN ” . Screening for the condition has RB been controversial . ( Journal of the Royal Society of Medicine , The Economist ) Fantastic voyage Surgeons for a while have been able to steer robotic devices such as catheters but a JJ “ self - driving ” model uses artificial intelligence and image - processing to reach its destination . CD analogy consists of fighter pilot and fighter plane : “ The fighter plane takes on the routine tasks IN flying the plane , so the pilot can focus on the higher - level tasks of the mission . ” ( NNP Robotics ) Best meal of the day Missing breakfast MD mean an increased NN of cardiovascular NN . ( Journal of the American College of Cardiology ) Traveller NN The traveller community suffers poor NN outcomes because of problems accessing NN and education services . How can GPs and hospitals support this neglected group ? ( BMJ , 28 m ) FT NNP is free to read — please forward and encourage others to register here Contact us via NNP , NNP , LinkedIn or email health@ft.com Latest NN at www.ft.com/health and on NNP @FTHealth Greta Thunberg , the 16 - NN old NN NN activist and Asperger ’s sufferer , has taken the NN by storm , but too JJ NNS with NN still face cruel NN . ( The Guardian )

text: “ Leaky gut NN NN doubted ” , was the headline from BBC NNP on March 17 2008 . The Daily Telegraph and the Daily Mail RB reported that researchers have VBN no evidence to support the ’ leaky gut NN ’ . They say that this NN proposes that NNS such as MMR damage the intestine causing digestive problems , leading to the production of peptides “ which can damage the brain and possibly VB NN ” . This well conducted NN used reliable analysis techniques to compare autistic NNS across a broad range of intelligences to age - matched NN NNS . Despite the newspaper headlines and coverage , the NN did not look at the effects of the MMR jab and NN . Instead , it tested and compared the urine of autistic boys with the urine of boys without NN . The researchers conclude that there were no differences between the levels of peptides in the groups and say they have effectively disproved the ’ leaky gut NN ‘ . However , further NN is needed to establish whether a casein and gluten - free diet has other effects on NN . The researchers call for more studies into special diet as a NN for NN , but they do not suggest that their NN has any implication for the discredited MMR NN / NN NN . Where did the NN come from ? Dr Hilary Cass from the Great Ormond Street Hospital for NNPS and colleagues from around England and Scotland carried out the NN . The authors acknowledge the support of the NN and development fund of the Royal Hospital for Sick NNPS in Edinburgh and the Chief Scientist Office in Scotland . Competing interests were declared . The NN was published in Archives of NNP in Childhood , a peer - reviewed medical journal . What kind of scientific NN was this ? This was a case NN NN that compared 65 boys with NN , aged between five and 11 NNS , with 158 NN boys of a similar age . The researchers say that , for a number of NNS , it has been thought that the urine of NNS with NN contains opioid peptides that originate from outside the NN . Opioid peptides are chemical compounds that are so called because they resemble morphine . They can be produced by the NN and through the digestion of foods such as grain and milk . Grains such as wheat , rye , barley and oats contain the protein gluten , that produces opioid peptides in the gut , while milk produces another variety , casein . CD NN for the development of NN is the ’ leaky gut NN ‘ : the idea that NNS with NN become sensitive to gluten . The gluten is thought to inflame the small bowel . The resulting damage allows opioid peptides from food to be absorbed into the NN and then enter the urine . Before the opioid peptides in the NN are excreted they are assumed to cross into the brain and result in the NNS of NN . Previous NN has proposed that excluding casein and gluten ( milk and grains ) from the diet might VB NNS with NN by reducing the amount of circulating opioid peptides . The NN proposes that opioid peptides VBN in urine reflect a disturbance in the integrity of the gut epithelium ( i.e. a leaky gut ) . Proponents of the NN hope that the peptides can act as a diagnostic marker for NN and predict that a diet excluding gluten and casein MD VB to treat NNS with autistic NNS . This NN aimed to determine the occurrence of the peptides in the urine of NNS who have NN and those who do not . The researchers recruited 65 boys from CD hospitals specialising in autistic spectrum disorders in London . For the NN group , 202 non-autistic boys of similar age were recruited from mainstream infant and primary schools in the same area . A questionnaire was given to the parents of the controls to ‘ screen out ’ NNS with possible neurological or psychiatric difficulties . Forty of the controls were excluded from the NN as their parents did not complete the questionnaire , or the boys ’ results were abnormal or borderline . Urine samples were collected from all the NNS and analysed using equipment that separates the chemical in a liquid ( HPLC ) . Other equipment was used to identify small and fragile biological molecules , such as the opioid peptides ( MALDI - TOF MS ) . What were the results of the NN ? The researchers say that their NN finds no evidence of opioid peptides in the urine of boys with NN or similar disorders . After adjusting for the amount of creatinine in the urine , which is a measure of kidney function , the researchers VBD no significant differences in the urinary profiles ( shown by HPLC ) between groups of boys with or without NN . In those NNS where HPLC showed peaks in the locations at which opioid peptides might be expected to be VBN , further testing by mass spectrometry ( MALDI - TOF ) showed that these peaks did not represent opioid peptides . What interpretations did the researchers draw from these results ? The researchers say that “ given the lack of evidence for any opioid peptiduria in NNS with NN it can neither serve as a biomedical marker for NN , nor be employed to predict or monitor response to a casein and gluten exclusion diet ” . The researchers say that these findings effectively disprove the ’ leaky gut NN ‘ , which predicts that these proteins should be VBN in the urine of autistic NNS . They suggest that healthcare professionals and parents should stop testing NNS with NN for urinary opioid peptides , and note that commercial laboratories around the NN still widely advertise these tests on the internet . What does the NHS Knowledge Service make of this NN ? This NN has a number of strengths . The researchers used accepted and applied definitions of NN and selected NNS across a broad range of intelligence . The urine testing appears to have been conducted reliably and the researchers further analysed the peptide peaks VBN by chromatography ( HPLC ) with advanced mass spectroscopy techniques ( MALDI - TOF ) . They acknowledge some limitations , however , including : • The autistic NNS were selected from tertiary or specialist centres . This MD mean that they had more severe NN than that commonly VBN in the community . • It was not possible to match the autistic NNS with low IQ to VB NNS with the same level of IQ . Strictly speaking , this means that the groups were not balanced at the start of the NN . However , as no significant differences were VBN in the peptide levels between any of the groups that were examined , it is unlikely that a link MD have been VBN between peptide levels and IQ either . The researchers say that there is no evidence that opioid peptides can leak through the gut and VB NN in NNS . However , further NN is needed to establish whether a casein and gluten - free diet has other effects on NN . The researchers do not comment on any implications of their NN with regard to the MMR NN . Immunisation is topical and attracts the reader ’s attention , but well - designed NN into other theories of how NN is caused is needed .

text: In the American political system , lobbying is par for the course . It has come to be expected that major industries , and the leading corporations in those industries , will seek to influence legislation , regulation , and the enforcement of NN decisions , such that they receive preferential NN . This MD come in the form of NN contributions , or actual lobbying , with a lobbyist working on behalf of the corporation that has paid them to influence a particular vote or governmental decision . What it is they are lobbying for , though , is a more involved question . Here , using data from opensecrets.org , we break down lobbying efforts , industry by industry , combining all political contributions and lobbying spending from Jan. 1998 to March 31 , 2020 . Figures are calculations by the Center for Responsive Politics based on data from the Senate Office of Public Records . Let 's take a closer look at how much each industry spends on lobbying , the top corporate spenders in each category , and what spurs their lobbying efforts . text: The drug maker Sanofi Pasteur is entering the race to develop a NN to protect against the JJ NN sweeping through China , the NN announced Monday . David Loew , Sanofi ’s JJ head of NNS , announced the NN MD partner with the U.S. Biomedical Advanced NNP and Development Authority — VBN as BARDA — to make a NN using the NN ’s recombinant DNA platform . Loew VBD the NN ’s previous work to develop a NN for NN — a cousin NN — gives it a leg up on this work . “ Addressing a JJ NN threat such as this newest NN is VBG to take a collaborative effort , which is why we are working with BARDA to quickly advance a potential NN candidate , ” VBD Loew . “ While we are lending our expertise where possible , we VBP the collaboration with BARDA MD provide the most meaningful results in protecting the public from this latest outbreak , ” he VBD . Loew VBD the NN expects to have a NN candidate — a prototype — to test in vitro within six months and MD be ready to test the NN in NNS within a NN or 18 months . Loew noted the DNA recombinant platform is already used to make NN NN licensed in the U.S. , which means regulators are familiar with it . Sanofi RB has JJ - scale manufacturing capacity for these types of NNS . Sanofi is the second major NN maker to announce it will try to make a NN against the JJ NN , which has infected over 70,000 NNS , mostly in China . text: NNP has a problem with more than just JJ NN . Add NN misinformation on the JJ network to the list . Revealed Thursday : The JJ network VBZ it will reduce distribution and provide users with " authoritative NN " on the topic . NNP is following the lead of Pinterest , which has blocked all searches using terms related to NNS or vaccinations as part of a plan to stop the spread of misinformation related to anti-vaxx posts . In mid-February , NNP VBD USA TODAY it had " taken steps " to reduce JJ NN NN and anti-vaxx posts and VBD it was considering making anti-vaccination content on its site less visible amid a NN outbreak that has reignited a conversation about preventative shots . At the NN , NNP VBD , " we VBP we have more to do . JJ NN sites have grappled with how to handle anti-vaxx posts from users amid a NN outbreak in Washington NN affecting more than 60 NNS . — It will reduce the ranking of NNP groups and Pages that spread misinformation about vaccinations in NN Feed and Search . " These groups and Pages will not be included in recommendations or in predictions when you type into Search , " NNP VBD . — When it discovers ads with misinformation about vaccinations , " we will reject them . " — NNP VBD it has removed related targeting options , IN “ NN controversies , " in ads . " For ad accounts that continue to violate our policies , we MD take further action , such as disabling the ad account . " Additionally , NNP VBD it MD n't show or recommend content that contains misinformation about vaccinations on the Explore section of NNP - owned Instagram or on its hashtag pages . text: NN NNS , according to the best scientific evidence available today , will only work against 10 % of the circulating viruses that VBP the NNS of seasonal epidemic influenza . Additionally , NN NNS have been VBN to elicit inflammatory reactions that MD harm the JJ heart , the developing fetus , and the fragile immune systems of our infants . So , do the theoretical benefits really outweigh the VBN harms ? In a recent article , The Shocking Lack of Evidence Supporting NNP NNPS , we addressed the surprising lack of empirical evidence supporting the use of NN NNS in the prevention of seasonal influenza , in NNS under CD , healthy adults , the elderly , and healthcare workers who care for the elderly . The reality is that NNS not only do not work as advertised , but they represent a significant NN threat , likely on the same order of magnitude as influenza itself , due to their well - VBN role in compromising immunological self - tolerance ( autoimmunity ) , as well as by eliciting a wide range of adverse NN effects associated with the use of adjuvants , preservatives , foreign animal DNA and cell byproducts , adventitious viruses , and other so - called “ inactive ingredients , ” including RB the unnatural route and method of antigen administration itself . [ i ] Basic Virology Facts Reveal Trivalent NN NNS Are At Best 10 % Effective But it should n’t take expensive , elaborate , NN - consuming NN to grasp the obvious limitations in effectiveness of NN NNS from the perspective of this fundamental fact of influenza virology : Indeed , if facts IN these were not so commonly ignored or denied , and it was the actuallyclinically - confirmed , unequivocal “ evidence ” that drove the so - called “ evidence - based ” medical system into its annual , seasonal influenza - induced , frenzy of pro-vaccine propagandizing and proselytizing , we might look at this ritual of mass NN as something other than just a profit- , policy - , and , for the masses , faith - based indoctrination , which sadly it has become . “ NN - Based ” Medicine Unwilling To Look At Empirical Evidence On NN Harms Similarly , were those self - avowed “ skeptics , ” and MD - be advocates of “ NN - based medicine , ” who claim vaccinating is always safer and more effective than not vaccinating , to acknowledge NN indicating the limitations and increasing failings of NN , as well as the value of natural influenza NN alternatives , * they might someday earn the NN to use powerful - sounding words IN “ NNP ” and “ Evidence ” in their crusade against your access to the empirical NN and your NN to bodily self - possession , i.e. your NN to make free and informed decisions for yourself to engage or disengage from medical interventions , that carry a VBN NN of harm and RB death . The reality is that JJ top biomedical journals cannot and will not suppress the NN concerning the JJ unintended , adverse NN effects of NNS . This MD , after all , be both immoral and illegal , especially when JJ lives , and particularly the lives of our most vulnerable , our NNS , are on the line . In other words , by publishing empirical NN that shows NNS are not safe and effective a priori , JJ thwart the party line , as represented by the policies and official statements of the CDC , the FDA , and the ACIP , and JJ online skeptic bloggers ( anti-anti - NN groups , if you will ; most whom fail to grasp the foolishness of such a dialectic , since they rarely take a critical look in the mirror ) who claim those refusing NNS , or educating about their harms , are guilty of crimes , or have NN on their hands . For example , a concerning NN published in 2011 in the International Journal of Medicinerevealed a fact rarely addressed by conventional NN authorities , or the mostly uncritical mainstream NN , namely : NN NNS result in inflammatory cardiovascular NNS indicative of increased NN for serious heart - related events such as heart attack . [ ii ] Titled , “ Inflammation - related effects of adjuvant influenza A NN on platelet activation and cardiac autonomic function , ” their NN concluded : The four main areas of concern mentioned above are : • Platelet Activation : An indicator of increased NN for pathological clotting and / or obstruction of a NN vessel , e.g. heart attack , embolism or stroke . • Sympathovagal imbalance towards adrenergic predominance : An indication of disturbed autonomic regulation within the heart . • Elevation of C- Reactive Protein : An indicator of inflammation - mediated cardiovascular NN NN . This NN is not , however , the JJ to raise concern over NNS of pathological inflammation caused by NN NNS , and NNS in general . In 2011 , the journal NNP published a NN titled , “ Inflammatory responses to trivalent influenza NN NN among pregnant women , ” which VBD that NN NN causes measurable increases in inflammation in pregnant women which MD increase the NN of preeclempsia and other adverse outcomes such as preterm birth .[ iii ] In this NN both CRP and tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) -α levels increased to concerning levels between CD to CD days after NN . Should we be surprised , considering NN NNS still contain highly inflammatory , neurotoxic and immunotoxic heavy metals , such as mercury - based thimerosal ? RB when the precautionary principle is employed , and mercury - based adjuvants removed in tacit recognition of its profound dangers , aluminum hydroxide is then used to replace it , injected directly into the bodies of healthy infants in the name of synthetically modifying and “ improving ” their immunity ( VB : Can We Continue To Justify Injecting Aluminum Into NNS ? ) . And so , despite the fact that NN - induced disruption and dysregulation of a pregnant woman ’s immune system MD compromise her pregnancy , resulting in birth defects [ iv ] and miscarriage ( which is a well - VBN phenomena within the veterinary field : NN - induced abortion ) , the CDC has defied both common sense and the precautionary principle by urging pregnant women to receive NN NNS , without informing them of their true risks . Infants At NN of Pathological Inflammation Following NNS Just as disturbing is the CDC ’s recommendation that all infants , six months or older , receive NN NNS on top of an already burgeoning NN schedule , which begins at the day of birth with the STD NN containing hepatitis B NN antigen , despite clear evidence that infants experience cardiorespiratory complications and C - reactive protein responses as a result of all NNS , administered either singularly or simultaneously in combination . CD 2007 NN published in the Journal of Pediatrics , VBD that 85 % of newborn infants experienced abnormal elevations of CRP when administered multiple NNS and up to 70 % in those given a single NN . RB , overall , 16 % of infants were reported to experience NN - associated cardiorespiratory events within 48 hours postimmunization . [ v ] Suffice it to say , vaccinating against the NN ( or any pathogen ) is not as safe and effective as we are being VBN . But please do not adopt my opinion on the matter as your own . Do your own NN , and feel free to review some of the underreported and / or otherwise suppressed NN on NN we have collated at our NN NNP and Education page . * Never mind the timelessly and often cross-culturally confirmed and reconfirmed evidence contained within “ orally transmitted ” traditional , plant - based medical systems , used the NN over . • None [ ii ] Gaetano A Lanza , Lucy Barone , Giancarla Scalone , Dario Pitocco , Gregory A Sgueglia , Roberto Mollo , Roberto Nerla , Francesco Zaccardi , Giovanni Ghirlanda , Filippo Crea . text: It ’s easy to confuse viruses and bacteria . They are both extremely tiny , for CD thing , and , depending on what kind of bug you VBP , they can make you sick . OK , “ extremely tiny ” and “ make you sick ” ? We do have technical words for these things . Viruses and bacteria are microscopic , meaning they are too small to VB with the unaided eye . And pathogens are “ NN - producing agents , ” especially viruses and certain kinds of bacteria . But , there are JJ differences between viruses and bacteria too — and they ’re not just important to VB to ace your NN exams . These differences can be vital to your NN and safety . A NN is an ultramicroscopic ( 20 to 300 nm in diameter ) , metabolically inert , infectious agent that replicates only within the cells of living hosts , mainly bacteria , plants , and animals : composed of an RNA or DNA core , a protein coat , and , in more complex types , a surrounding envelope . NN , explained in everyday words , is an extremely tiny particle that causes an infectious NN . It is generally made up of some RNA or DNA coated in protein . It can only multiply in the cell of hosts that are alive . That means , technically , viruses are not themselves living . In informal contexts , NN is RB commonly used to refer to the NN caused by the NN . And of course , NN has another special meaning when it comes to computers . Where does the word NN come from ? The word NN entered English around 1590 – 1600 . It comes directly from the Latin vīrus , meaning “ slime , poison . ” The adjective virulent is RB ultimately derived from the Latin vīrus . In medical and scientific settings , virulent specifically means “ highly infective ” or “ causing clinical NNS . ” More generally , virulent can mean “ actively poisonous , ” “ violently hostile , ” or “ intensely bitter . ” What does bacteria mean ? text: Solidarity with NNP ’s Most Vulnerable Prerequisite for Overcoming Crisis , Secretary - General NNP as Humanitarian Chief Warns ‘ Stakes Have Never Been Higher ’ Standing in solidarity with those least able to protect themselves from the NN - CD NN is not only the JJ thing to do , but the only NN the NN will overcome this , NNP Nations Secretary - General António Guterres VBD the NNP and NNP Council , which launched a JJ call to action at its 2020 Humanitarian Affairs Segment , convened from 9 to 11 June via videoconference due to NN - related restrictions . The 54 - member NNP and NNP Council launched the Call to Action in support of the humanitarian response in fighting the NNP - CD NN , including a set of 13 concrete actions encompassing flexible funding , fast - tracking NN and aid personnel at borders and special measures to serve vulnerable populations . The actions aimed to save lives and prevent the spread of NN - CD , given that during the span of the three - day meeting , the number of confirmed NNS rose to 7.1 million from 6.9 million , and the death toll reached 408,000 since the outbreak was reported . The Call to Action stated : “ As the NN faces the unprecedented challenge of responding to the NN - CD NN , we must commit to act with urgency and determination to respond to this crisis . We must recommit to doing so through international solidarity , cooperation , unity and humanity . ” The Council called for urgent , determined measures to meet humanitarian needs and prevent and mitigate further devastating humanitarian impacts on those disproportionately impacted by the NN , including women and NNS , older persons , persons with disabilities , refugees , internally displaced persons and migrants . Provisions of the Call to Action RB urged Member NNPS and other potential donors to support scaling up emergency efforts to contain the NN and consider urgently funding the NNP Humanitarian Response Plan to meet its requirements , without diverting funds from other areas of need . Other provisions called upon Member NNPS to work closely with the NNP Nations and to facilitate the provision of humanitarian assistance , including fast - tracking the passage of NN and humanitarian personnel at borders and in -country , ensuring their NN , safety and well - being , and designating them as essential workers . The action plan further called on Member NNPS and other relevant stakeholders to take steps to prevent speculation and undue stockpiling that MD hinder access to safe , effective and affordable essential medicines , NNS , personal protective equipment and medical equipment , as well as to provide access to and fair distribution of all essential NN technologies and products , including their requisite components and precursors , as a JJ priority , and to urgently remove unjustified obstacles . All stakeholders were asked to heed the Secretary - General ’s calls to address NNP - CD , including for an immediate JJ ceasefire so as to lessen the devastating humanitarian effects of armed conflicts and to enable more emphasis on responding to the NN . The 2020 Humanitarian Affairs Segment focused on the theme “ Reinforcing humanitarian assistance in the context of the seventy - fifth anniversary of the NNP Nations : taking action for NNS - centred solutions , strengthening effectiveness , respecting international humanitarian law and promoting the humanitarian principles ” . Since 1998 , the Humanitarian Affairs Segment has been a platform for discussing issues related to strengthening the coordination and effectiveness of the NNP Nations humanitarian assistance , including assessing progress and identifying emerging issues , obstacles and challenges . It RB promotes the sharing of experiences and lessons learned at national and regional levels . During the 2020 Humanitarian Affairs Segment , NNP and NNP Council members participated in a high - level event on combating and preventing sexual and gender - based violence in humanitarian crises and three interactive high - level panels , focusing on NN , technology and assisting internally displaced persons . Prior to the opening session , the Chairs of the Operational Activity for Development Segment and the Humanitarian Affairs Segment jointly convened a virtual high - level panel event on 8 June on the theme “ Transition from Relief to Development : The multidimensional and interconnected challenges in the Central Sahel region : reducing needs , risks and vulnerabilities for NNS through closer humanitarian , development and peacebuilding collaboration . ” Side events were RB held virtually on the following themes : saving lives , building trust , and informing humanitarian action : how good practice and lessons learned from community engagement can VB beat NNP - CD ; strengthening the protection of NNS during NNP - CD : launching the NNP Protection Minimum Standards ; anticipatory approach to NNP - CD and other crises ; and counter - terrorism and humanitarian action in the age of NNP - CD . The following side - events were held on 12 June : mental NN and psychosocial support for displaced and migrant populations during the NN - CD NN and beyond ; humanitarian consequences arising from the use of explosive weapons in populated areas ; and towards more inclusive and disaggregated data on displacement . Secretary - General António Guterres , delivering the keynote address in a NN message , VBD that RB before the NNP - CD NN , the NN faced unprecedented levels of humanitarian suffering . Now , at a NN when the NN threatens to increase hunger and poverty and VB the reversal of decades of development gains , he urged Member NNPS and other donors to swiftly fund the NNP - CD NNP Humanitarian Response Plan and sustain funding to existing humanitarian operations . “ We must act now to save lives and prevent future suffering , ” he VBD . “ When JJ rights are at the centre , we deliver better outcomes . ” Emphasizing that respect for international law must form the foundation of the response , he VBD the wider drivers of suffering around the NN must RB be examined , including persistent inequalities , NN NN and prolonged conflict . He RB wished participants a constructive segment . Chaired by NNP and NNP Council Vice - NNP Omar Hilale ( Morocco ) , the opening session featured : Mark Lowcock , Under - Secretary - General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator ; Henrietta Fore , Executive Director of the NNP Nations NNP ’s Fund ( UNICEF ) ; Qu Dongyu , Director - General of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the NNP Nations ( FAO ) ; and Abby Maxman , Chief Executive Officer of Oxfam . Peter Maurer , NN of the International Committee of the Red Cross ( ICRC ) , sent a NN message . Mr. Lowcock VBD : “ this NN is unlike anything we have dealt with in our lifetime ; extraordinary measures are needed . Our response must be proportionate to the scale of the problem we face . ” Emphasizing that discussions over the coming days present an opportunity to harden the resolve to fight the NN and find solutions , he declared that “ the stakes have never been higher ; we will either win this battle together , or not at all . ” Laying out the landscape , he VBD that as of 8 June , there are 6.9 million confirmed NNS worldwide , approximately 1 in every 1,100 NNS . Over the past month , rapid increases have been reported in Africa , from roughly 55,000 NNS on 8 NNP to more than 190,000 a month later , and in Latin America and the Caribbean , which is now considered the epicenter of the NN , with 1.3 million NNS . The NN is set to peak in the most fragile places on NNP in the next three to six months and MD potentially be catastrophic in the developing NN .
