text: Part 5 : The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation Masks Its Own Ineptitude by Attacking ‘ NNP Theorists ’ and ‘ Vigilantes ’ Spiro Skouras , former executive producer at Newsbud , has emerged as CD of the more engaging and erudite of the young investigative journalists who have been delving into the Wuhan NNP epidemic . Skouras has documented the position of JJ prominent figures that have questioned the dubious claim that the source of NN - CD infection was a diseased animal in Wuhan ’s open - air food market . Skouras has argued it MD be “ negligent ” for researchers to refrain from investigating “ the full array of possibilities ” on how the contagion originated and how it spread . Among the JJ figures , Skouras interviewed on the crisis was Francis Boyle , the renowned professor of international law at the NNP of Illinois . Prof. Boyle drafted the Biological Weapons and Terrorism Act , legislation that enabled US ratification of the UN ’s Biological Warfare Convention in 1990 . Prof . Boyle indicated in his interview with Skouras that NNP - CD is most likely a genetically - engineered pathogen that escaped from the so - called Biosafety Laboratory in Wuhan . Prof . Boyle indicated , Prof . Boyle points to the fact that the NNP NN leaked out from a Beijing lab in 2004 . He describes as “ propaganda ” the widely promulgated opinion that NNP - CD originated in Wuhan ’s exotic , open - air food market . Prof . Boyle expanded some of his interpretations in a subsequent interview published by GreatGameIndia . Skouras specifically asked Dr. Boyle about his relationship with mainstream NN given his record as CD of the foremost academic experts on international law and military culture concerning the development of bioweaponry in the NNP NNPS . Dr. Boyle responded that he was pretty much blacklisted from commenting on the subject of biological warfare ever since he publicly shared his interpretation of the anthrax attacks on CD US Senators in October of 2001 . There has been considerable scholarly scrutiny of the anthrax attacks targeting the US Congress and some NN organizations in early October of 2001 . The anthrax attacks constitute the most serious assault ever on the operations of the US Congress , the primary interface between law and politics in the NNP NNPS . These attacks have come to be understood as an integral part of the JJ NN of crimes committed in Manhattan and Washington DC on 9/11 . The anthrax attacks killed five NNS including CD postal workers . Seventeen NNS were injured and Congress was shut down for a few days . Anthrax - laden letter attacks were specifically directed at CD Democratic Party Senators , Patrick Leahy and Tom Daschle . When they received the contaminated letters both lawmakers were engaged in questioning provisions of the post - 9/11 emergency measures legislation VBN as the Patriot Act . Both Senators Leahy and Daschle were hesitant to rubber stamp the enactment that was seemingly instantly drafted and put before Congress within three weeks of the 9/11 debacle . The anthrax attacks took place just as the US Armed Forces began invading Afghanistan where the culprits of the 9/11 crimes were supposed to be hiding out . The perpetrators of the anthrax attack , who we were supposed to imagine at the NN as al - Qaeda terrorists , succeeded in easing aside the major locus of opposition to the Patriot Act ’s speedy passage in late October . Why , PRP might legitimately ask , ask , MD Islamic jihadists VB the Patriot Act to be rushed through Congress . In early October the US Armed Forces invaded Afghanistan at the same NN that the US executive branch was seeking with the Patriot a license to kill and torture and steal without any checks of accountability . Once the US Armed Forces went to war with Afghanistan on the basis of a fraudulent explanation of 9/11 ’s genesis , there was basically no chance that a genuine and legitimate evidence - based investigation of the September 11 crimes MD ever take place . To this day the JJ War on Terror continues to unfold on a foundation of lies and illusions that have had devastating consequences for the quality of NN for average NNS throughout the NNP NNPS and the NN . In his 2005 book , Biowarfare and Terrorism , Prof . Boyle ’s analysis pointed to major problems in the FBI ’s investigation of the anthrax attacks including the agency ’s destruction of relevant evidence . To Prof . Boyle , the highly refined military - grade quality of the anthrax made it almost certain that the anthrax bioweapon was produced within the US Armed Forces at the lab in Fort Detrick Maryland . Anthrax , or Bacillus anthracis , is a rod - shaped bacteria VBN naturally in soil . Looking RB at the episode Dr. Boyle observed , “ The Pentagon and the C.I.A. are ready , willing , and able to launch biowarfare when it suits their interests . They already attacked the American NNP and Congress and disabled our Republic with super - weapons - grade anthrax in October 2001 . ” Prof . Boyle ’s interpretation was later verified and expanded upon in a book by Canadian Prof. Graeme MacQueen . Prof . Boyle acknowledges the veracity of Prof. MacQueen ’s NN of the anthrax deception as part of a “ domestic NN . ” He sees The 2001 Anthrax Deception as the most advanced finding of academic NN on the topic so far . Prof. MacQueen is prominent among a very JJ group of academics and public officials who condemn the official narrative of 9/11 for its dramatic inconsistencies with the available evidence . Those who share this understanding include former Italian Prime Minister Francesco Cossiga , former German Defence Minister Andreas von Bülow , former UK Minister of the Environment Michael Meacher , former Assistant Secretary of the US Treasury Paul Craig Roberts , former Director of the US Star Wars Missile Defense Program Lt. Col. Bob Bowman , Princeton International Law Professor Richard Falk , and the author of ten academic books on different aspects of the 9/11 debacle , Claremont Graduate NNP Professor David Ray Griffin . Prof. Francis Boyle shared the 9/11 skepticism of JJ when he asked , In his coverage of the Wuhan NNP epidemic , Spiro Skouras highlighted the proceedings VBN as Event 201 . Event 201 brought together in NNP York on October 18 , 2019 an assembly of delegates hosted by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation , the NNP NNP Forum and the Johns Hopkins Center for NNP Security . The gathering anticipated the NNP - CD crisis by just a few weeks . I retrospect it is almost as if Event 201 announced JJ of the controversies about to arise with the outbreak of the real epidemic in Wuhan China . Event 201 performed functions similar to those of the drills that frequently mimic the engineered scenarios animating false flag terror events but especially those of 9/11 . A major subject of the meeting highlighted the perceived need to VB communications during an epidemic . Levan Thiru of the Monetary Authority of Singapore went as far as to call for “ a step up on the part of governments to take action against NNP NNP . ” Thiru called for recriminatory litigation aimed at criminalizing “ bad actors . ” Cautioning against this kind of censorship , Skouras asked , Who is VBG to decide what constitutes “ JJ NN ” ? If fact checkers are to be employed , “ who will fact check the fact checkers ” ? Hasti Taghi , a NN executive with NBC Universal in NNP York , was especially outspoken in condemning the activities of “ NN theorists ” that have organized themselves to question the motives and methods of the complex of agencies involved in developing and disseminating NNS . She frequently condemned the role of “ NN theories ” in energizing public distrust of the role of pharmaceutical NNS and NN conglomerates in their interactions with NN . Tom Ingelsby of the Johns Hopkins Center for NNP Security injected an interesting twist into the discussion . He asked , “ How much NN of NN should there be ? By whom should NN of NN be exercised ? How can false NN be effectively challenged ? ” Ingelsby then added , “ What happens if the false NN is coming from NNS and governments ? ” This final question encapsulates a major problem for conscientious citizens trying to find their NN through the corruption and disinformation that often permeates our key institutions . Those that try to counter the problem that governments and corporations sometimes peddle false NN can pretty much expect to face accusations that they are “ NN theorists . ” Too often the calculations involved in deciding whom or what is credible ( or not ) depends primarily on simple arithmetic favouring the preponderance of wealth and power . Spiro Skouras gives careful consideration to the possibility that the NNP NNPS instigated the NNP - CD epidemic starting in Wuhan China . He notes the precedent set in 1945 on the atomic attacks by the US NN on the civilian populations of Hiroshima and Nagasaki . Skouras points out that there is proof that since the Second NNP War , the US NN has conducted at least 239 experiments , secretly deploying toxic chemical and biological agents against portions of its own population . On the history of US involvement in biological warfare VB here , here and here . Skouras highlights the window presented for a covert US bioweapon attack at the NNP Military Games in Wuhan China in the second half of October of 2019 . He notes that 300 US soldiers participated as athletes in the Wuhan Military Games together with a JJ contingent of American support personnel . The timing and the circumstances of the event were more or less ideal to open up a JJ pathogenic front in the US NN ’s informal “ hybrid war ” against China . On Feb. 15 at the Munich Security Conference , US Defence Secretary , Mark T. Esper , developed a highly critical characterization of Chinese wrongdoing in order to seemingly justify recriminatory actions . Esper asserted , “ China ’s growth over the NNS has been remarkable , but in JJ ways it is fuelled by theft , coercion , and exploitation of free market economies , private NNS , and colleges and universities … Huawei and 5G are today ’s poster NN for this nefarious activity . The US antagonism to Huawei ’s leadership in the design and worldwide dissemination of 5 G technology might well be a factor in the scandal generated by the Chinese connection to intertwined NN in microbiology at the level 4 labs in Winnipeg and Wuhan . RB in 2000 the notorious report entitled Rebuilding America ’s Defenses , a publication brought forward by the neoconservative Project for the NNP American Century ( PNAC ) , proposed that the US NN should refurbish and invoke its capacity to wage biological warfare . PNAC was the NN tank that anticipated the events of September 11 , 2001 by outlining a strategic scheme that MD only be realized by mobilizing American public opinion with “ a catalytic event IN a NNP Pearl Harbor . ” After 9/11 , the PNAC Team of related neoconservative activists and Zionist organizations pretty much took over the governance of the NNP NNPS along with the build up and deployment of its formidable war machine . PNAC called for the invocation of “ advanced forms of biological warfare that can ‘ target ’ specific genotypes . ” In this fashion “ biological warfare might be transformed into a politically useful tool . ” The relationship of this NN to internal disagreements within China has been put on full display in Steve Bannon ’s coverage of the crisis entitled War Room : NNP . A prominent member of US NNP Donald NNP ’s inner circle , Steve Bannon is often accompanied on the daily show by Chinese billionaire dissident , Miles Guo ( aka Guo Wengui , Miles Haoyun , Miles Kwok ) . Guo is an outspoken Chinese refugee . He is a persistent critic of virtually every facet of the policies and actions of the Chinese Communist Party . Guo regularly condemns those who dominate China ’s CD - party system , a system run by an elite who , he alleges , are corrupt , incompetent and inveterate liars . Guo regularly asserts that all of the Chinese NN ’s numbers on the NN , including death rates and infection rates , can probably be multiplied by 10X or RB 100X to VB closer to accuracy . [ On the 10X guestimate of mortality and infection VB this . ] Clearly Bannon and Guo MD VB to VB the emergency conditions created by the NN as a wedge of division , protest and regime NN within China . CD of the subjects they regularly raise , as do others who accuse the Chinese NN of systematic lying and deception , is that the crematoriums in Wuhan and nearby Chongqing are burning corpses of dead NNS at a rate far higher than official death figures . Some reports indicated that portable incinerators were being brought into the most infected core of the Wuhan NNP epidemic . It is troubling , to say the least , that some reports indicate dead NNS are being cremated far faster and at far higher rates than the Chinese NN and the NNP NNP Organization are reporting . Some reckoning with the apparent disparity between reported and actual deaths has led to widespread suspicions about what is actually VBG in the scenes of violent and angry exchanges between NNS in the Wuhan area . JJ of these videos show brutal confrontations between Chinese civilians and Chinese security police . The displays of desperation by some of those trying to escape apprehensions by uniformed officials seem sometimes to suggest the severity of a NN or death struggle . It is made to seem that those seeking to escape the grip of authorities are aware that their failure to do so might lead to a quick death and a quick exit by incineration . These reflections are , of course , speculative rather than definitive . Questions concerning who we are supposed to VB or not in this crisis are becoming ever more pressing and volatile . CD of the emerging themes in the discourse developed at War Room : NNP is the propensity of some of the core agencies of mainstream NN in the NNP NNPS to accept at face value the reports they receive from official NN outlets answering to the Chinese Communist Party . To Banning and Guo this pattern makes NN organizations IN the NNP York Times , The Washington Post , and CNN essentially propaganda extensions of the Chinese NN . The Chinese NNS themselves are clearly grappling in JJ ways with the problem of how to understand the NN and directives given them by the governing apparatus of the Chinese Communist Party . Clearly the Party initially failed the NNS by not intervening early and decisively enough after the JJ NNS of NN illness began to show up . The exit from Wuhan of almost five million NNS in prior to the Chinese Lunar NNP NNP celebrations had huge implications for spreading the contagion . As noted in the introduction , the death in Wuhan of Dr. Li Wenliang on 7 February has become a flash point for popular criticism of the Chinese Communist Party led by General Secretary Xi Jinping . Dr. Li wrote to members of his medical school alumnus group suggesting that some significant action should be taken in response to the appearance of NN - JJ NNS that suddenly afflicted his patients . For sending out this unauthorized communication , Dr. Li was summoned along with seven other supposed offenders to the Public Security Bureau . There he was warned by police to stop “ making false statements . ” He was ordered to cease and desist “ spreading rumors , ” and “ acting illegally to disturb JJ order . ” Dr. Li signed a form indicating he MD refrain from continuing to do what he had been accused of doing . The chastised professional returned to his medical practice . He took his own advice and began treating patients exhibiting signs of the JJ illness . He himself soon died from NNP - CD when it was still VBN as CD - nCoV . Is NNP ’s permanent deplatforming of the Zero Hedge web site a North American version of the police intervention in China with the goal of silencing Dr. Li ? Is the censorship of the Internet in the name of opposing “ NN theorists ” repeating the Chinese Communist Party ’s effort to silence Dr. Li ? Is Dr. Li to be appropriately understood as a Chinese version of a “ NN theorist ” ? How different was his NN for allegedly “ spreading rumours ” and “ acting illegally to disturb JJ order ” from the NN of those in the Occident who have been deplatformed , smeared and professionally defrocked for attempting to speak NN to power ? I have developed responses to these incursions based on hard - won experiences facing the propaganda blows of an especially powerful political lobby able to seize NN of the governing board of my NN . These professional lobbyists seek to discredit academic analysis of their own violations of law , ethics and civility by labelling critics of their zealotry as “ NN theorists ” or worse . More recently I have been grappling against a variation on this process in trying to counter the censorious attacks on the American Herald Tribune . These assaults on free expression and open debate began with the machinations of military hawks whose hit job instructions were passed along to the disinformation specialists at CNN and the Washington Post . No NN can say for sure where the Wuhan NNP epidemic is taking the NN . Wherever we are headed , however , we are leaving behind an era that can never be recreated . Whatever happened to originate the contagion , this crisis is forcing us to take stock of the framework of biological warfare as it has been developing in China , Russia , Israel and probably JJ other NNS . Nowhere , however , is biological warfare being more expansively and expensively developed and probably deployed than by the US Armed Forces . The death and destruction that humanity is presently experiencing should signal to us that it is NN to VB much more serious about inspecting military facilities and enforcing the terms of the Biological Warfare Convention of 1972 . It is , in fact , NN to VB much more serious about enforcing all aspects of international criminal law in balanced ways that transcend the biases of Victors ’ Justice . It is NN to throw off the weight of the pseudo - laws introduced after 9/11 through abhorrent tactics IN the inside - job military anthrax attack on Congress . Most certainly , it is NN to draw a clear distinction between NN in the field of public NN and NN in the development of lethal bioweapons . Better yet , we should work towards putting an end altogether to militarization through the massive expansion of the " death sciences . " The vile activities of fallen practitioners of the endangered NN sciences are , for starters , undermining the integrity of our besieged institutions of higher learning .

text: BERLIN ( Reuters ) - German drugmaker CureVac , in which the NN is taking a sizeable stake to VB fund a NN - CD NN , is planning an initial public offering in the NNP NNPS next month , a finance ministry document seen by Reuters on Monday showed . The finance ministry VBD in a letter to parliament ’s budget committee dated June 15 that CureVac “ currently has a big capital requirement and plans a flotation on the Nasdaq in NNP York in July 2020 . ” European biotech firms prefer the Nasdaq because the U.S. capital market offers a critical mass of highly specialised biopharma investors , analysts say . German biotech firms BioNtech and Morphosys have recently sought U.S. listings . The ministry added in its letter that the decision to acquire a stake in CureVac had to be made quickly given legal requirements attached to the planned flotation , which is expected to take place in mid-July . Economy Minister Peter Altmaier on Monday confirmed an earlier Reuters report that Germany will take a stake in the unlisted biotech NN . The deal values the firm at 1.3 billion euros . That follows reported attempts by the U.S. NN to acquire CureVac or its assets in March , which stirred a backlash in Germany , with NN officials voicing support for keeping CureVac German . Altmaier VBD the NN wanted to strengthen the NN sciences and biotech sectors in Germany , and that it MD not have any influence over CureVac ’s business strategy . “ With this investment we aim to give CureVac financial security so that it can continue to work on NN production with the same commitment , ” Altmaier VBD a NN conference . A NN source VBD the measure reflected German concerns about relying too much on overseas suppliers for healthcare products and equipment . Dietmar Hopp , co-founder of software firm SAP and owner of a more than 80 % stake in CureVac , VBD none of the existing CureVac investors MD sell shares to the NN , and that their stakes MD be diluted by the deal on a pro-rata basis .

text: Unsubstantiated safety scares have been associated with JJ declines in HPV NN uptake in several NNS . Immunization programs ’ resilience to shocks is central to their success , but little empirical evidence documents resilience in action . We sought to characterize the decline of HPV NN in Denmark after negative NN coverage and recovery during a national NN NN . In the period with some negative NN coverage , HPV NN uptake fell to 83.6 % ( 95 % CI :78.0 % –89.7 % ) of baseline uptake . In the period with extensive negative NN coverage , uptake fell RB further to 49.6 % ( 95 % CI:44.5 % –55.2 % ) of baseline uptake . After the NN NN , HPV NN uptake recovered to its baseline level ( 109.2 % , 95 % CI:90.1 % –132.4 % ) due in part to catch - up doses . text: It is CD of the most serious allegations that MD be made about a NN : manipulating patients ' histories to make money . So it is no wonder that the charges , levied by editors of the British Medical Journal ( BMJ ) in January against medical researcher Andrew Wakefield , are still getting close scrutiny . Now an American whistleblower advocacy group has joined the fray over Wakefield , who in 1998 hypothesized a link , now scientifically disproven , between the NNS , mumps and rubella NN ( MMR ) and NN . On November 9 , David Lewis of the National Whistleblower 's Center in Washington DC published a letter in the BMJ ( http://bmj.com) arguing that Wakefield did not commit NN fraud . Lewis VBD Nature that he thinks the combination of public charges and a slow , secretive investigation has left the public not knowing whom to VB and is unfair to the accused researcher . " [ The system ] throws NNS IN Andy into a no - NN 's - land , " Lewis VBZ . Wakefield was the lead author of a 1998 paper in The Lancet ( A. J. Wakefield et al. Lancet 351 , 637–641 ; 1998 ) reporting on the case histories of 12 NNS who had received the MMR NN and developed NNS of NN or inflammatory bowel NN . The paper inflamed public fears about NNS , but it was retracted in 2010 after the UK General Medical Council ( GMC ) concluded that Wakefield had a charge of serious professional misconduct to answer , in part because it VBD that his team did not have proper ethical approval for tests performed on the NNS . Later in the NN , the GMC VBD him guilty of the misconduct charge and revoked his licence to practice as a NN . By then , more than 12 JJ - scale epidemiological studies had failed to find evidence of the hypothesized link ( J. S. Gerber and P. A. Offit Clin. Infect . Dis. 48 , 456–461 ; 2009 ) and the MMR NN is today regarded as safe . But was the paper merely mistaken , or a deliberate fraud ? Articles by medical journalist Brian Deer published in the BMJ in 2010 and 2011 accused Wakefield of reporting histories for the NNS that were not consistent with their records and their parents ' recollections , at a NN when Wakefield was RB being paid by lawyers intending to sue MMR manufacturers . Deer 's articles themselves did not allege fraud , but on their basis a BMJ editorial in January 2011 called the paper fraudulent . Wakefield has always denied allegations of manipulating data or having a financial motive in the Lancet paper , but no institution has yet ruled on the matter . In March , NNP College London ( UCL ) , which took over divisions of the Royal Free Hospital where Wakefield worked , VBD it had launched an investigation . In the meantime , Lewis , a microbiologist and former whistleblower who VBZ he was falsely accused of misconduct after alleging links between JJ illness and the spreading of sewage sludge , asked Wakefield for the chance to review his files . His claims are not likely to challenge the conclusion based on much other evidence that the NN does not trigger NN . But they MD complicate the debates about Wakefield 's integrity and the UCL investigation . The documents that Lewis reviewed include confidential forms describing biopsies from the guts of NNS . The forms were filled out by pathologists Andrew Anthony and Paul Dhillon , who worked with Wakefield at the Royal Free . These documents , Lewis VBZ , are relevant to Deer 's charge that records he obtained do not support Wakefield 's claims in the Lancet paper that the NNS had nonspecific colitis , a supposed element of an MMR - induced syndrome . On sheets for three of the NNS graded by Anthony , the handwritten word " colitis " appears , and Dhillon checked a box labelled " non-specific " on 10 forms . Anthony 's sheets are dated after the Lancet publication , whereas Dhillon 's are dated before . Lewis believes that the sheets show that Anthony and Dhillon were making good - faith diagnoses of colitis . Anthony , who has left UCL , MD not be reached by Nature , and Dhillon indicated that UCL had VBN him not to comment . ( Neither has been accused of manipulating data . ) Before publishing Lewis 's letter , the BMJ asked Ingvar Bjarnason , a gastroenterologist at King 's College Hospital , London , to review the materials . Bjarnason VBZ he does n't VB they are sufficient to support claims in the Lancet paper of a JJ NN process . He RB questions whether " non-specific " on the grading sheets refers to colitis , saying it MD refer to any kind of gut NNS . But he VBZ that the forms do n't clearly support charges that Wakefield deliberately misinterpreted the records . " The data are subjective . It 's different to say it 's deliberate falsification , " he VBZ . Deer notes that he never accused Wakefield of fraud over his interpretation of pathology records . But he VBZ that records read to him from the Royal Free pathology service clearly stated that the NNS 's gut biopsies were within normal limits , RB though they were reported in the Lancet paper as having enterocolitis . Fiona Godlee , the editor of the BMJ , VBZ that the journal 's conclusion of fraud was not based on the pathology but on a number of discrepancies between the NNS 's records and the claims in the Lancet paper . She VBZ she will be calling for a public inquiry into the matter , noting that it has been more than a NN since she RB informed UCL about concerns over Wakefield 's work . Wakefield denies charges of data manipulation . He VBZ that UCL has yet to officially request his response to any charges and he is n't convinced that the inquiry will give him a fair hearing . A UCL spokesman VBZ that the investigation will be " thorough , fair and wide - ranging " . But eight months after announcing its inquiry , the NN is still looking for a suitable external chairman . text: Rinderpest ( RB cattle plague or steppe murrain ) was an infectious viral NN of cattle , domestic buffalo , and JJ other NNS of RB - toed ungulates , including buffaloes , JJ antelope , deer , giraffes , wildebeests , and warthogs . [ 2 ] The NN was characterized by fever , oral erosions , diarrhea , lymphoid necrosis , and high mortality . Death rates during outbreaks were usually extremely high , approaching 100 % in immunologically naïve populations . [ 3 ] Rinderpest was mainly transmitted by direct contact and by drinking contaminated NN , although it MD RB be transmitted by air . [ 4 ] After a JJ eradication NN since the mid-20th century , the last confirmed case of rinderpest was diagnosed in 2001 . [ 5 ] On 14 October 2010 , the NNP Nations Food and Agriculture Organization ( FAO ) announced that field activities in the decades - JJ , worldwide NN to eradicate the NN were ending , paving the NN for a formal declaration in June 2011 of the JJ eradication of rinderpest . [ 6 ] On 25 NNP 2011 , the NNP Organisation for Animal NNP announced the free status of the last eight NNS not yet recognized ( a total of 198 NNS were now free of the NN ) , officially declaring the eradication of the NN . [ 7 ] In June 2011 , the NNP Nations FAO confirmed the NN was eradicated , making rinderpest only the second NN in history to be fully wiped out ( outside laboratory stocks ) , following smallpox . [ 8 ] In June 2019 the UK destroyed its stocks of rinderpest NN , held at the Pirbright Institute in Surrey , which were most of the NN 's retained samples . This followed the compilation of a digital record of the NN 's genetic code , thereby obviating the need to store samples as a protective resource in case the NN re-emerges . Researchers at Pirbright and the NNP Nations expressed a hope that the other samples in laboratories around the NN will RB be destroyed , totally eradicating the NN from the NNP . [ 9 ] Rinderpest is believed to have originated in Asia , later spreading through the transport of cattle . [ 10 ] The term Rinderpest is a German word meaning " cattle - plague " . [ 2 ] [ 10 ] The rinderpest NN ( RPV ) was closely related to the NNS and canine distemper viruses . [ 11 ] The NNS NN possibly emerged from rinderpest as a zoonotic NN around 600 BC , a period that coincides with the rise of JJ JJ settlements . [ 12 ] [ 13 ] Rinderpest NN ( RPV ) , a member of the genus Morbillivirus , is closely related to the NNS and canine distemper viruses . [ 11 ] IN other members of the Paramyxoviridae family , it produces enveloped virions , and is a negative - sense single - stranded RNA NN . The NN was particularly fragile and is quickly inactivated by heat , desiccation and sunlight . [ 14 ] NN NN evolved from the then - widespread rinderpest NN most probably between the 11th and 12th centuries . [ 13 ] The earliest likely origin is during the seventh century ; some linguistic evidence exists for this earlier origin . [ 15 ] [ 16 ] Death rates during outbreaks were usually extremely high , approaching 100 % in immunologically naïve populations . [ 3 ] The NN was mainly spread by direct contact and by drinking contaminated NN , although it MD RB be transmitted by air . [ 4 ] Initial NNS include fever , loss of appetite , and nasal and eye discharges . Subsequently , irregular erosions appear in the mouth , the lining of the nose , and the genital tract . [ 3 ] Acute diarrhea , preceded by constipation , is RB a common feature . [ 4 ] Most animals die 6 - 12 days after the onset of these clinical signs . [ 3 ] The NN is believed to have originated in Asia , later spreading through the transport of cattle . [ 10 ] Other cattle epizootics are noted in ancient times : a cattle plague is thought to be CD of the 10 plagues of Egypt described in the Hebrew Bible . By around 3,000 BC , a cattle plague had reached Egypt , and rinderpest later spread throughout the remainder of Africa , following European colonization . [ 10 ] In the 4th century Roman writer Severus Sanctus Endelechius described rinderpest in his book , On the Deaths of Cattle . [ 17 ] Cattle plagues recurred throughout history , often accompanying wars and military campaigns . They hit Europe especially hard in the 18th century , with three JJ panzootics , which although varying in intensity and duration from region to region , took place in the periods of 1709 – 1720 , 1742 –1760 , and 1768 –1786 . [ 18 ] In the early 18th century , the NN was seen as similar to smallpox , due to its analogous NNS . The personal physician of the pope , Giovanni Maria Lancisi , recommended the destruction of all infected and exposed animals . This policy was not very popular and used only sparingly in the JJ part of the century . Later , it was used successfully in several NNS , although it was sometimes seen as too costly or drastic , and depended on a strong central authority to be effective ( which was notably lacking in the Dutch Republic ) . Because of these downsides , numerous attempts were made to inoculate animals against the NN . These attempts met with varying success , but the procedure was not widely used and was no longer practiced at all in 19th - century Western or Central Europe . Rinderpest was an immense problem , but inoculation was not a valid solution . In JJ NNS , it caused too JJ losses . RB more importantly , it perpetuated the circulation of the NN in the cattle population . The pioneers of inoculation did contribute significantly to knowledge about infectious diseases . Their experiments confirmed the concepts of those who saw infectious diseases as caused by specific agents , and were the JJ to recognize maternally derived immunity . [ 11 ] The JJ written report of rinderpest inoculation was published in a letter signed " T.S. " in the November 1754 issue of The Gentleman 's Magazine , [ 11 ] a widely read journal which RB supported the progress of smallpox inoculation . This letter reported that a Mr Dobsen had inoculated his cattle and had thus preserved 9 out of 10 of them , although this was retracted in the next issue , as it was apparently a Sir William St. Quintin who had done the inoculating ( this was done by placing bits of material previously dipped in morbid discharge into an incision made in the dewlap of the animal ) . These letters encouraged further application of inoculation in the fight against diseases . The JJ inoculation against NNS was made three NNS after their publication . [ 11 ] From early 1755 onwards , experiments were taking place in the Netherlands , as well , results of which were RB published in The Gentleman 's Magazine . As in England , the NN was seen as analogous with smallpox . While these experiments were reasonably successful , they did not have a significant impact : The total number of inoculations in England appears to have been very limited , and after 1780 , the English interest in inoculation disappeared almost entirely . [ 11 ] Almost all further experimentation was done in the Netherlands , northern Germany and Denmark . Further trials in the Netherlands Due to a very severe outbreak at the end of the 1760s , some of the best - VBN names in Dutch medicine became involved in the struggle against the NN . Several independent trials were begun , most notably by Pieter Camper in Groningen and Friesland . The results of his experiment in Friesland were encouraging , but they proved to be the exception ; testing by others in the provinces of Utrecht and Friesland obtained disastrous results . As a result , the Frisian authorities concluded in 1769 that the NN of rinderpest was NNP 's displeasure with the sinful behavior of the Frisian NNS , and proclaimed 15 November a day of fasting and prayer . Interest in inoculation declined sharply across the country . [ 11 ] In this NN of discouragement and scepticism , Geert Reinders , a farmer in the province of Groningen and a self - taught NN , decided to continue the experiments . He collaborated with Wijnold Munniks , who had supervised earlier trials . They tried different inoculation procedures and a variety of treatments to lighten the NNS , all of them without significant effect . Although they were not able to perfect the inoculation procedure , they did make some useful observations . [ 11 ] Reinders resumed his experiments in 1774 , concentrating on the inoculation of calves from cows that had recovered from rinderpest . He was probably the JJ to make practical use of maternally derived immunity . [ 11 ] The detailed results of his trials were published in 1776 and reprinted in 1777 . His inoculation procedure did not differ much from what had been used previously , except for the use of three separate inoculations at an early age . This produced far better results , and the publication of his work renewed interest in inoculation . For the period of 1777 to 1781 , 89 % of inoculated animals survived , compared to a 29 % survival rate after natural infection . [ 11 ] In the Netherlands , too , interest in rinderpest inoculation declined in the 1780s because the NN itself decreased in intensity . Apart from the Dutch Republic , the only other regions where inoculation was used to any significant level were northern Germany and Denmark . Experiments started in Mecklenburg during the epizootic of the late 1770s . " Insurance NNS " were created which provided inoculation in special " institutes " . Although these were private initiatives , they were created with full encouragement from the authorities . Though neighboring NNS followed this practice with interest , the practice never caught on outside Mecklenburg ; JJ were still opposed to inoculation . [ 11 ] While some experimentation occurred in other NNS ( most extensively in Denmark ) , in the majority of European NNS , the struggle against the NN was based on stamping it out . Sometimes this MD be done with minimal sacrifices ; at other times , it required slaughter at a massive scale . [ 11 ] A major outbreak affected the whole of the British Isles for three NNS after 1865 . [ CD ] Around the turn of the century , a plague struck in Southern Africa . [ CD ] The outbreak in the 1890s killed an estimated 80 to 90 % of all cattle in eastern and southern Africa , as well as in the Horn of Africa . Sir Arnold Theiler was instrumental in developing a NN that curbed the epizootic . The loss of animals caused famine which depopulated sub-Saharan Africa , allowing thornbush to colonise . This formed ideal habitat for tsetse fly , which carries sleeping sickness , and is unsuitable for livestock . [ 20 ] In his classic NN of the Nuer of southern Sudan , E. E. Evans - Pritchard suggested rinderpest might have affected the Nuer 's JJ organization before and during the 1930s . Since the Nuer were pastoralists , much of their livelihood was based on cattle husbandry , and bride - prices were paid in cattle ; prices MD have changed as a result of cattle depletion . Rinderpest might RB have increased dependence on horticulture among the Nuer . [ 21 ] A more recent rinderpest outbreak in Africa in 1982 –1984 resulted in an estimated US $ 2 billion in stock losses . [ 22 ] In 1917 – 18 , William Hutchins Boynton ( 1881 –1959 ) , the chief veterinary pathologist with the Philippine Bureau of Agriculture , developed an early NN for rinderpest , based on treated animal organ extracts . [ 23 ] [ 24 ] Walter Plowright worked on a NN for the RBOK strain of the rinderpest NN for about a decade , from 1956 to 1962 . [ 25 ] Plowright was awarded the NNP Food Prize in 1999 for developing a NN against a strain of rinderpest . In 1999 , the FAO predicted that with NN , rinderpest MD be eradicated by 2010 . [ 26 ] Widespread eradication efforts began in the early 20th century although , until the 1950s , they mostly took place on an individual country basis , using NN campaigns . In 1924 , the NNP Organisation for Animal NNP ( OIE ) was formed in response to rinderpest . [ 28 ] In 1950 , the Inter - African Bureau of Epizootic Diseases was formed , with the stated goal of eliminating rinderpest from Africa . [ 28 ] During the 1960s , a program called JP 15 attempted to vaccinate all cattle in participating NNS and , by 1979 , only CD of the NNS involved , Sudan , reported NNS of rinderpest . [ 28 ] In 1969 , an outbreak of the NN originated in Afghanistan , travelling westwards and promoting a mass NN plan , which by 1972 , had eliminated rinderpest in all areas of Asia except for Lebanon and India ; both NNS were the site of further occurrences of the NN in the 1980s . [ 28 ] During the 1980s , however , an outbreak of rinderpest from Sudan spread throughout Africa , killing millions of cattle , as well as wildlife . [ 28 ] In response , the Pan - African Rinderpest NNP was initiated in 1987 , using NN and surveillance to combat the NN . [ 28 ] By the 1990s , nearly all of Africa , with the exception of parts of Sudan and Somalia , was declared free of rinderpest . [ 28 ] Worldwide , the NNP Rinderpest Eradication Programme was initiated in 1994 , supported by the Food and Agriculture Organization , the OIE , and the International Atomic NNP Agency . [ 28 ] This program was successful in reducing rinderpest outbreaks to few and far between by the late 1990s . [ 28 ] The program is estimated to have saved affected farmers 58 million net euros . [ 29 ] The last confirmed case of rinderpest was reported in Kenya in 2001 . [ 30 ] Since then , while no NNS have been confirmed , the NN is believed to have been present in parts of Somalia past that date . [ 30 ] The final vaccinations were administered in 2006 , and the last surveillance operations took place in 2009 , failing to find any evidence of the NN . [ 30 ] In 2008 , NNS involved in rinderpest eradication efforts believed a good chance existed that rinderpest MD join smallpox as officially " wiped off the face of the planet " . [ 5 ] The FAO , which had been co-ordinating the JJ eradication program for the NN , announced in November 2009 that it expected the NN to be eradicated within 18 months . [ 31 ] In October 2010 , the FAO announced it was confident the NN has been eradicated . [ 6 ] The agency VBD that " [ a ] s of mid 2010 , FAO is confident that the rinderpest NN has been eliminated from Europe , Asia , Middle East , Arabian Peninsula , and Africa , " which were the locations where the NN had been last reported . [ 6 ] Eradication was confirmed by the NNP Organization for Animal NNP on 25 NNP 2011 . [ 7 ] On 28 June 2011 , FAO and its members NNS officially recognized JJ freedom from the deadly cattle NN . On this day , the FAO Conference , the highest NN of the UN agency , adopted a resolution declaring the eradication of rinderpest . [ 32 ] The rinderpest eradication effort is estimated to have cost $ 5 billion . [ 33 ] Stocks of the rinderpest NN are still maintained by highly specialized laboratories . [ 30 ] In 2015 , FAO launched a NN calling for the destruction or sequestering of the remaining stocks of rinderpest NN in laboratories in 24 different NNS , citing risks of inadvertent or malicious release . [ 34 ] On 14 June 2019 the largest stock of the rinderpest NN was destroyed at the Pirbright Institute . [ 35 ] Rinderpest was CD of more than a dozen agents the NNP NNPS researched as potential biological weapons before terminating its biological weapons program . [ 36 ] Rinderpest is of concern as a biological weapon for the following reasons : • The NN has high rates of morbidity and mortality . • The NN is highly communicable and spreads rapidly once introduced into nonimmune herds . • Cattle herds are no longer immunized against RPV , so are susceptible to infection . text: NN : I was in the stay - home - until - it 's - safe camp . But I just can't take it anymore . I ’m inherently lazy , so I hate working out . Given my druthers , I ’d spend my days eating NN cream bonbons and watching episodes of " The Real Housewives . " It ’s odd then , that the thing I miss most about the NN before NN and stay - at - home orders is VBG to the gym . For 40 NNS , the gym has been the thread that tied my physical being to my precarious sanity . Murder trials , surgery and personal tragedies have never kept me from the gym for more than CD weeks . So when rabid armed protesters recently stormed NN capitals demanding businesses reopen , the stupidest part of me hoped they MD succeed and end my months of gym exile . CD camps , largely paralleling America ’s CD political parties , have formed since the initial shock of NNP - CD ’s JJ rampage . My status as a die - hard Democrat placed me firmly in the “ stay at home until it ’s safe ” faction . And I ’ve not been shy about deriding the gun-toting mobs who insisted on standing shoulder to shoulder as they emptied their lungs at governors who are desperately trying to keep their citizens safe . Rand Paul , Andy Biggs : Anthony Fauci wants America closed until there 's nothing to reopen But as NN has worn on , I ’ve abandoned what I thought was the moral high ground in camp stay - at - home . JJ circumstances have convinced me that cities should reopen sooner rather than later . A NN looks more unlikely No NN but NNP Donald NNP ’s most cultish supporters believed his promise that this NN MD disappear with warm weather , or that we MD have a NN in three to four months . But at the outset of the federal guidelines that placed the NNP NNPS into suspended animation , JJ of us believed that the Centers for NNP NNP and Prevention , and endless NN resources , MD quickly find a NN — and a NN MD follow in due NN . More than CD months in , as the U.S. death toll barrels toward 100,000 , those assumptions have proved wrong , and the most basic precepts of viral epidemiology have been thrown into question . Usually , when NNS successfully fight a NN , they develop antibodies that protect against further infection . But NNS who have contracted and survived NNP - CD appear able to VB reinfected after winning the battle of their lives . The NNP NNP Organization announced last month that the antibodies that normally keep NNS safe from reinfection might not work against the NN . Since NNS function by stimulating antibody production , this revelation means the chance of an effective NN is far from guaranteed . A stark reality is being whispered by leading NN experts : the majority of the NN ’s population MD be exposed to the NN . When lockdowns began , most of us were willing to stay home and make the necessary sacrifices we believed guaranteed safe passage to the other side . Flights , weddings and dental appointments were rescheduled months down the road . But given that June is likely to be no different than September , and July no different than November , staying home wo n’t deliver us to the safety zone that prompted the shelter - in - place orders in the JJ place . This is n't a vacation : I 'm a survivor of domestic abuse . Quarantine with my father MD have been hell . It ’s true that if no NN ever leaves home , viral transmission will end . But this is not economically feasible . If the U.S. Treasury continues to print money with little to no manufacturing or labor to VB it up , the house of cards will eventually fall . I realize this statement has dropped me into traitor territory . But to the chorus from the left : No , reopening the country due to JJ considerations is not the same as saying money is more important than JJ NN . We face JJ realities every day , independent of the NN . Gun violence , drunken drivers , transmissible diseases and a panoply of other dangers MD all be brought to a screeching halt if we locked down indefinitely . But a NN of home confinement is not a NN in which most of us MD VB to live . Reopen — with eyes open to the risks With more NNS reopening over the next several weeks , NNS are likely to VB that local NN officials have determined things are safe . They ’re not . Texas was CD of the JJ NNS to reopen and recently saw its highest single day of JJ NNS since the NN began . While reopening is a necessity , it need not be reckless . Governors have a continuing duty to tailor reasonable restrictions to community conditions . The value in early shelter - in - place orders was that overwhelmed hospitals were given an opportunity to stabilize and avoid rationing NN . That ’s a justification worthy of respect , and we should prepare ourselves to accept the possibility of local rolling shutdowns due to filled hospital beds and occupied ventilators . For the past CD months I ’ve stayed safe by staying home , limiting my grocery shopping excursions to once a week . I ’d VB to visit family , but the thought of picking up NN at Trader Joe ’s and unintentionally killing my own parents is a Greek tragedy I ’m desperate to avoid . Moving into the third month of home isolation , the toll on each of us is different . Some face financial hardship . Some have seen their education thrown into limbo . For me , the longer I ’m home alone , the more my obsessive - compulsive disorder flares . I did n’t realize this until a phone call in which a friend asked whether I was staying safe . I explained that I had VBN a NN to test myself for NN : Loss of taste is CD of the JJ signs of infection , so I bought a 5 pound tub of jelly beans with 49 flavors . I eat several handfuls daily , CD bean at a NN . If I recognize each of the different flavors , I figure that I ’m safe . The dead silence on the line convinced me it was NN to book a Zoom therapy session . When the gravity of this NN made itself VBN , I expected my NN to protect me . But NNP has spent CD months blaming former NNP Barack Obama for a lack of personal protective equipment , peddling snake - oil cures and denying the shortage of NN - CD test kits . Sadly , the NN has shown that in order to make it through this crisis , we ’re VBG to have to fend for ourselves . As cities reopen , each of us will have hard choices to make . Choices about working from home , VBG to restaurants and visiting friends . I ’ve decided I ’ll VB the gym , but not restaurants or movie theaters . I ’ve RB decided that despite the discomfort , I ’ll wear a mask when I ’m in an indoor public NN — every NN . Staying out of harm ’s NN in the NN of NN promises to be a never - ending struggle to balance NN and reward . I hope I strike the JJ balance . I cringe at the idea of the progressive NNP crowd posting NN of my untimely demise as a cautionary tale . Michael J. Stern , a member of USA TODAY 's Board of Contributors , was a federal prosecutor for 25 NNS in Detroit and Los Angeles . Follow him on NNP : @ MichaelJStern1

text: What happened to little , red - haired Hannah Poling is hardly unique in the NN of NN . She had an uneventful birth ; she seemed to be developing normally  smiling , babbling , engaging in imaginative play , speaking about 20 words by CD months . And then , RB after receiving a bunch of NNS , she fell ill and it all stopped . Hannah , now 9 , recovered from her acute illness but she lost her words , her eye contact and , in a matter of months , began exhibiting the repetitive behaviors and JJ withdrawal that typify NN . " Something happened after the NNS , " VBZ her mom , Terry Poling , who is a registered nurse and an attorney . " She just deteriorated and never came RB . " Parents of kids IN Hannah have been fingering NNS  and , in particular , the mercury - based NN preservative thimerosal  as a NN of NN for over a decade , but researchers have repeatedly failed to find a link . What 's unique about Hannah 's case is that for the JJ NN federal authorities have conceded a connection between her autistic NNS and the NNS she received , though the connection is by no means simple . A panel of medical evaluators at the Department of NNP and NNP Services concluded that Hannah had been injured by NNS  and recommended that her family be compensated for the injuries . The panel VBD that Hannah had an underlying cellular disorder that was aggravated by the NNS , causing brain damage with features of NN spectrum disorder ( ASD ) . A special federal NN court has yet to award damages , but the recommendation , made public last week , is causing a sensation in the NN advocacy community . The Polings , who live in Athens , Ga. , were originally part of a group of nearly 5,000 families with autistic NNS seeking damages through the National NNP Injury Compensation Program . The other NNS remain before the court . The Poling case is RB causing deep concern among public NN officials , eager to reassure parents that NNS are safe and , indeed , hugely beneficial . In a public statement on Friday , Dr. Julie Gerberding , director of the Centers for NNP NNP and Prevention ( CDC ) , insisted that " the NN has made absolutely no statement about indicating that NNS are the NN of NN , as this MD be a complete mischaracterization of any of the NN that we have at our disposal today . " Gerberding and other NN authorities point out that the benefits of NNS far exceed their risks . They RB note that thimerosal was eliminated from routinely administered childhood NNS manufactured after 2001 , and yet NN rates have continued to climb . The current CDC estimate is that 1 of 150 American NNS has an NN spectrum disorder . Nonetheless , there 's no denying that the court 's decision to award damages to the Poling family puts a chink  a question mark  in what had been an unqualified defense of NN safety with regard to NN . If Hannah Poling had an underlying condition that made her vulnerable to being harmed by NNS , it stands to reason that other NNS might RB have such vulnerabilities . text: The chloroquine narrative started with several small studies from China and France — both of which have shortcomings and offer few lessons for patients at JJ . The French results are based on only 36 NNS and focus on the patients ’ viral load , or the amount of NN in the NN . But there is no current evidence that ACE inhibitors worsen NN - CD outcomes in humans , according to the American Heart Association , the European Society of Cardiology ’s Council on Hypertension , and a March 20 review published in the European Heart Journal . NNS with high NN pressure and heart NN do appear to be at higher NN for NN - CD , but that probably has more to do with the underlying ailments themselves . What ’s more , ACE inhibitors MD have anti-inflammatory properties , which MD VB the lungs of NN - CD patients better cope with the infection . ( Learn how these underlying conditions make NN more severe . ) “ That MD be a key NN , to compare NNS with high NN pressure plus or minus these drugs , to VB if there ’s any difference , ” Perlman VBZ . “ But it ’d be very hard to do , and probably very hard to ethically justify . ” “ By all means , if you ’re having emergency breathing NNS or something ’s troublesome , we do VB you to seek emergency attention , ” VBZ Purvi Parikh , an allergy and infectious NN specialist at NYU Langone in NNP York City . The CD groups are processed in different parts of the waiting room , separated by at least six NNS of NN . In the UK , NHS 111 advises those displaying mild NNS remain at home , and has set up an online symptom - checker to self - asses how severe any infection MD be so the patient can make a decision on whether to seek further NN . For those arriving with serious NNS such as difficulty breathing , NN care workers start by focusing on the patient ’s oxygen levels , NN pressure , and the amount of fluid in their lungs — all in an effort to keep their condition stable . They RB try to manage fever , which can VB discomfort and lead to cell damage . The most severe NNS of NN - CD require putting a patient on a mechanical ventilator — a device that cycles air in and out of a person ’s lungs — for more than a week at a NN . That ’s why NN officials are so concerned about a coming ventilator shortage . text: Lloyd - Smith and other mathematicians are assessing the strong and weak points in travel screening as it pertains to the NN - CD outbreak . Their latest work is inspired by a NN they published in 2015 , which built a model that systematically estimated the performance of traveller screening programs during outbreaks of NN , MERS , influenza , and Ebola . As in this earlier work , the JJ model for NNP - CD includes basic factors IN the failure rate for thermometer guns or how easily the NN moves between NNS . But it RB accounts for more subtle variables , IN how JJ NNS might transmit the NN before their NNS arise , or how often NNS accurately report their NNS on screening questionnaires distributed at airport customs . “ It 's pretty evident from past outbreaks that NNS are n't always honest about risky exposures , ” Lloyd - Smith VBZ . “ Based on the past data we had , it looked IN CD in four passengers accurately and honestly reported the risky exposures they had . ” Compute all these variables , and their model estimates that enhanced screening is at best catching 50 percent of infected air travellers and at worst just 20 percent , primarily because NN - CD NNS are so latent . “ Based on what we understand about this NN , something on the order of half of NNS are fundamentally not detectable [ during screening ] , ” Lloyd - Smith VBZ . While the results are currently being peer - reviewed at the journal eLife , they mirror what preliminary results from a separate NN group at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine predict for air traveller screening with NNP - CD . “ We 'd probably only catch about 45 percent of infected travelers using exit screening , ” VBZ Samuel Clifford , an epidemiologist at the London School ’s Center for Mathematical Modeling of Infectious Diseases . “ Out of the remaining 55 percent of NNS who are n't caught , we can catch a few more on entry . You 've got 42 percent of the NNS [ with NNP - CD ] still making it into the country . ” While such models can offer an indication of what might be happening , you can VB these dynamics play out in real - NN by setting your sights on CD nation : Singapore . Singapore boasts CD of the highest - regarded NN care systems on the planet , thanks to public funding , low costs for NN , and an abundance of doctors , nurses , and other NN professionals . This workforce pays off during an outbreak , because it means that Singapore can catch NNS the moment patients arrive on their shores . “ Singapore had such a remarkable record during NNP with following NNS , and it seems to have a high ratio of detection this NN around , ” VBZ Marc Lipsitch , an epidemiologist at Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public NNP . He thinks tracking the NN - CD situation in Singapore can VB gauge how the outbreak might evolve in other NNS , especially in areas with developed NN care systems or places that receive high volumes of travelers from China . The NNP NNPS fits both aspects of this billing , given that it receives as JJ travellers from China as Singapore , roughly three million a NN . Based on preliminary modelling in Lipsitch ’s lab , Singapore ranked RB out of 191 NNS in NN surveillance during the JJ weeks of NNP - CD . His team suspects that Singapore 's methods are exceptionally sensitive to JJ NNS , and can thus serve as a standard of comparison against other NN systems . By using Singapore as a standard bearer for NN - CD detection , his team can then estimate how JJ NNS are likely VBG unnoticed in other NNS . Relative to Singapore , other nations with a high capacity for NN surveillance — IN the U.S. , Japan , Thailand , and afflicted NNS in Europe — MD only be catching 38 percent of travel - related NNS , based on Lipsitch ’s model . That ’s due in part to Singapore officials ’ dogged efforts toward border screening , but RB because the island country is dense . Its 5.6 million NNS are packed into an area on par with Charlotte , North Carolina , which makes it easier to trace the contacts connected to individual NNS . “ If there are [ NNP - CD ] carriers coming into the NNP NNPS that are n’t detected , which is likely the case , Singapore MD probably have an equivalent number , ” VBZ Scott Gottlieb , a former U.S. FDA commissioner and resident fellow at the American Enterprise Institute who thinks Lipsitch ’s NN is on the JJ track . “ But they'd be unmasked sooner in Singapore because it 's a smaller , more densely populated nation . ” For this reason , Gottlieb VBZ that Singapore offers an omen for major cities in the U.S. , rather than the nation as a whole . “ They 're a good bellwether for what happens when an outbreak steps into a very sophisticated NN care system and advanced economy in a dense environment , ” he VBZ . There are caveats to Lipsitch ’s models , including that mild or asymptomatic NNS of NN - CD MD not be accounted for . Plus , these models are yet to be published in a peer - reviewed journal , though the process is under NN . But their results mirror what others are predicting about the leaky nature of travel restrictions and what they might mean for preparedness in at - NN NNS in places IN Africa . The model predicts that up to 89 percent of imported NNS might be VBG undetected in NNS with a low capacity for NN surveillance . And undetected NNS passing across borders are such a concern because they represent the JJ step to local transmission , the stage where an outbreak becomes disconnected from importation and begins to perpetuate freely in a region . On Thursday , researchers in Singapore , including CD from the ministry of NN , reported eight of the nation ’s 84 NNS are yet to be linked to any clear exposure . Meanwhile , the NNP - CD tally doubled in South Korea to 204 , due to an outbreak at a church in Daegu tied to a 61 - NN - old woman VBN only as “ Patient 31 . ” But the source of her infection is currently unknown . “ Although the total number of NNS outside China remains relatively small , we ’re concerned about the number of NNS with no clear epidemiological link , ” VBD Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus , director - general of the NNP NNP Organisation , VBD at a Friday press briefing . “ Apart from the Diamond Princess cruise ship , the Republic of Korea now has the most NNS outside of China . We ’re working closely with the NN to fully understand the transmission dynamics that led to this increase . ” More than 80 JJ NNS reported Friday are tied to Patient 31 , and Korea ’s Centres for NNP NNP & Prevention described this incident in Korea ’s fourth largest city as a super - spreader event . “ There is a real NN , ” Lipsitch VBZ , “ that there 's ongoing transmission in other NNS , which if it remains undetected is VBG to result in more and more NNS . ”

text: Hepatitis B is an infection of the liver caused by a NN that 's spread through NN and NN fluids . It often does not VB any obvious NNS in adults , and typically passes in a few months without NN . But in NNS , it often persists for NNS and MD eventually VB serious liver damage . text: Overall , MMR NN is implicated in 13 % of claims , most of which are events associated with immunization during the second NN of NN . Natural NNS infection is VBN to VB acute encephalopathy / encephalitis . Although the IOM VBD the evidence to be “ insufficient ” to determine whether NNS NN can VB acute encephalopathy , there is some evidence of clustering of encephalopathy / encephalitis NNS whose onset is 8 to 10 days following NNS - containing immunization , based on an analysis of 48 VICP claims . 111 Only rarely are biological markers demonstrated to support a genetic , metabolic , or NN NN . In only CD VICP case was cerebrospinal fluid NN antibody , a biological marker for NN causation , VBN in a previously healthy 2 - NN - old girl who received the JJ dose of MMR and varicella NN . JJ - onset seizures following MMR NN was alleged in some claims . Nearly all were febrile seizures occurring in the 7 - to 14 - day NN frame during which fever MD accompany replication of NN NN . The NNS that fell within the VIT onset interval were usually recommended for entitlement by VICP staff . Most such claims were adjudicated before residual seizure disorder was removed from the VIT . Another common diagnosis was thrombocytopenic purpura , a VIT condition with prescribed onset of 7 to 35 days following NN . Most involved NNS with documented thrombocytopenia within this interval . In some NNS , additional episodes of decreased platelets occurred in the ensuing months or NNS . JJ , however , showed normalization of their platelet count before the 6 months of continued effects required by the NCVIA . Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis ( SSPE ) claims have RB been identified , more than half of them deaths . Early hearings resulted in a few being compensated because of the initial lack of administrative resources to defend claims . Subsequent testimony by experts in infectious NN persuaded the court of the lack of any data supporting a causal connection , noting the tremendous decrease in SSPE incidence since licensure of the NN decades ago . Since then , claims of SSPE - related injury or death have been dismissed . Claims alleging injury from rubella NN comprise 2 % of claims overall . Most are filed on behalf of adult women who received NN in the postpartum period or for employment . In the majority of NNS , acute and chronic arthritis or arthralgia developed 7 to 90 days ( median , 14 days ) after rubella immunization . Neuropathy and fibromyalgia were the other diagnoses . A previous inventory of 113 nonacute arthritis claims filed starting in 1988 showed 28 % with chronic arthropathy or other generalized complaints similar to those of chronic fatigue syndrome and 30 % with a variety of non–vaccine - related conditions . Although 13 % to 15 % of susceptible ( serology - negative ) women MD experience transient arthritis after the currently used rubella NN , with a higher percentage ( up to 40 % ) reporting some type of musculoskeletal complaint , it is less clear what role , if any , the NN has in causing recurrent or chronic arthropathy ( ie , arthralgia or arthritis ) . 78,79 Based on the 1991 IOM finding that chronic arthritis MD be caused by rubella NN , a special master held a hearing to determine criteria necessary for proof of causation . Following the special master 's publication of these guidelines , the VICP added chronic arthritis to the VIT in the 1995 final rule45 and incorporated several of the court 's criteria in the 1997 final rule . 94 The main difference between the criteria adopted by the VICP and those adopted by the court has been the latter 's willingness to compensate arthralgia , a subjective symptom that is difficult to assess , unlike observable signs of arthritis . Adjudications to date have resulted in 70 claims being compensated and 123 being dismissed . Additional NN published since the IOM report , including retrospective case reviews and a prospective double - blind NN , has produced mixed results . If rubella NN does VB chronic arthropathy , it MD seem that the incidence is rare . 112–114

text: What if all it took for the NN to return to normal was a shot in the arm ? Politicians are repeating the mantra that a NN NN is the exit strategy . But getting there is neither simple nor RB guaranteed . " A NN is not a given , " VBD David Heymann , a professor of infectious NN epidemiology and distinguished fellow at Chatham House . There are hundreds of NN candidates in development , but the vast majority will fail . Assuming CD is successful , it MD take NNS to manufacture billions of doses for the entire globe . With this in mind , “ waiting for a NN is a poor , poor exit strategy , " Heymann argued . He and other experts say that the idea that a NN is the only NN out MD provide NNS with false hope and ignore other vital public NN measures already at our disposal . For example , politicians MD give equal attention to a NN - CD cure or to more comprehensive testing methods — or promote simple public NN measures IN hand washing . “ Instead of VBG for silver bullets and moonshots , the focus should be on doing the hard slog of public NN , " VBD Devi Sridhar , chair of JJ public NN at the NNP of Edinburgh . Here are four public NN measures that experts say need to be put in place . But spoiler alert : Most require up - front investment and have their own hurdles . CD of the clear ways out is knowing who has the NN . Testing was key at the start of the NN , but as NNS emerge from lockdown , " it acquires an RB more important position , " VBD John Middleton , NN of the Association of Schools of Public NNP in the European Region . As the number of infected NNS dwindles , pinpointing who has the NN makes it possible to put up a " cordon sanitaire " and focus on the ill and those they 've been in contact with . But it 's RB vital in another NN , he noted , by understanding factors IN the geographical extent of the spread . " You can look at surveillance and population studies to VB how far the NN has spread , and what level of immunity there might be in the country , " Middleton added . " That MD influence how safe it is to [ scale RB ] lockdown . " There are , as always , obstacles to surmount . RB , ramping up capacity has been a problem for JJ NNS . In the U.S. , cuts to public NN budgets mean that there 's a lack of qualified personnel and machinery . Testing capacity there had to be built from scratch , Middleton explained . In the U.K. , shortages of reagents meant that testing was reserved for those who were ill in the hospital . Inaccurate testing is another problem . With popular nasal swab tests , false negatives rates can be as high as three in 10 . For more precise NN tests , the opposite is a bigger problem — false positives leading NNS to VB they 've contracted the NN and are immune , thus skewing statistics , Middleton explained . " Politicians have seen it as a beauty contest — how JJ tests are done — without a proper understanding about the results , " Middleton VBD . The good NN is that the technology is improving , and better , more rapid tests are coming along , he added . Austrian geneticist Hans Lehrach , of the Max Planck Institute , thinks it 's NN for a completely JJ NN of testing . " This requires a different approach to testing as landing a NN on the moon required a different approach than hot air balloons , " Lehrach VBD . Lehrach 's idea is that governments MD test everyone in a given country or in the EU for five consecutive weeks by genetic sequencing . If NNS did this , they MD effectively eliminate the NN in that area . It MD require citizens ' and governments ' buy - in — literally . But so far , governments have been slow to take on this JJ testing approach . " Whatever we do will not be for free , " Lehrach VBD . But he argues that this approach MD eliminate the NN from the targeted area and allow NNS to VB RB to restaurants and work knowing " that everybody they meet is free of the NN . " If there 's CD immediate priority that governments should invest in for the short term , it 's contact tracing , argues Clare Wenham , assistant professor of JJ NN policy at the London School of Economics . “ The NNS that are able to resume normal NN — Hong Kong , Taiwan , South Korea — they ... have the infrastructure to be able to do really granular and effective contact tracing , ” Wenham VBD . This requires an effective application and staff who can “ join the dots . ” “ When CD person gets infected , [ the tracers ] can notify who they ’ve been in contact with , and reach the NNS that were n’t on the app for whatever reason . A bank of staff that can do that last mile , ” she VBD . Numerous European NNS are trying to do this already , including the U.K. and Germany . But they 're running into CD problems . JJ of these apps are n't interoperable across borders , so their effectiveness at fighting major public NN problems is not VBN . And JJ NNS are afraid of signing up . “ For a lot of Europeans , it ’s not a natural thing to have the NN tracking everything on your phone and your movements , ” VBD Wenham . Assuring NNS that their data is safe , and not being used for any other purposes — for example to be sold to third parties — is key here , Wenham added . " This is a dataset that MD be rich for selling , " she VBD . " You need to make sure that you have that data security . " CD major advantage that therapies have over NNS is that they 're easier to test — and therefore faster to bring to market . David Salisbury , an associate fellow at Chatham House and former director of immunization at the U.K. 's Department of NNP , explained that this comes down to the comparative ease of setting up clinical studies for drugs . " You test [ an ] antiviral in NNS who 've got the NN , and you hope to VB that those that you treat with the antiviral VB better and survive better than those who have a placebo or an alternative NN , " Salisbury explained . " With a NN , you 've got to show that it stops NNS actually getting infected , " he VBD . " So it has to be administered in a place where the NN is circulating , and administered in extremely JJ doses . " This means NN developers are constantly racing to roll out clinical trials in places where the NN is still on the rise . Recently , the NNP of Oxford and AstraZeneca launched a JJ wing of its phase 3 clinical trial in Brazil because that 's where the " epidemiological curve is still rising . " But regardless of whether and when a NN is developed , therapies are necessary , say experts . “ We need drugs before we VBP a NN , " VBD Nick Cammack , NNP - CD therapeutics accelerator lead at the Wellcome Trust . " We need drugs while we have a NN ... and we need drugs after we VBP a NN , because RB for conditions that we currently have NNS for you still have breakthrough NNS . " The JJ line of defense is coming from repurposed drugs , he noted at a webinar organized by the Wellcome Trust last week . These are medicines already developed to fight other diseases and are now being tested to VB if they VBP patients . The CD medicines that have been in the spotlight — remdesivir and hydroxychloroquine — fit into this category . However , evidence of their efficacy is , at best , spotty . Remdesivir , an antiviral developed to fight Ebola by drugmaker Gilead , has shown it can moderately shorten the duration of the NN . Malaria drug hydroxychloroquine promised some early hope but has since failed to pay off , with a major British trial declaring negative results . In the medium term , antibodies can RB be applied as a therapy , Cammack noted . Plasma from NNS who have already recovered from the NN carries antibodies against NN - CD . If it ’s injected into patients that are currently sick , it can give the immune system a boost to VB fight the NN . The problem : You ’re limited by the amount of recovered patients you can gather plasma from . An alternative approach is monoclonal antibodies , which are designed and can be mass - produced in a lab . U.S. drugmaker Eli Lilly has brought its monoclonal antibodies to phase 1 trial together with AbCellera , and expects results at the end of June . " In the next six to nine months we will VB if monoclonal antibodies that are specific for NN - CD show safety and efficacy , " Cammack VBD . " There 's much excitement around them as potential treatments . " Specific antiviral medicines to target NN - CD — likely to be small molecule drugs — are further away and require a number of trials . Beyond the measures noted above , experts argue , policymakers need to keep up basic public NN work that has become routine since lockdowns started : Washing hands , wearing a mask and keeping distance . " If [ NNS ] are underpinning activities in a country by protecting themselves by JJ distancing , that 's already a major step forward , " Heymann VBD . CD of the most important tools for politicians is clear communication , especially considering that the public needs to trust that these measures — testing , contact tracing , drugs and a NN , if it 's VBN — are safe . Trudie Lang , professor of JJ NN NN at the NNP of Oxford , VBD that this was a lesson RB learned from Ebola that 's being learned again now : Public NN measures are only as effective as the amount of trust the public has in them to work . “ What messages to use ? How to gain public trust ? ” Lang VBD , RB at the Wellcome webinar . " In the absence of drugs and NNS , these are things that we are left with . " And RB if we VBP a NN or an effective NN , CD of the clearest messages from public NN officials might be that the NN is here to stay . “ This NN is not VBG to VB away . Period , ” the NNP NNP Organization ’s David Nabarro VBD the BBC . “ We do n’t have a NN and we do n’t VB we ’re VBG to develop CD … so we ’ve all got to learn to live with this NN . ” This article is part of POLITICO ’s premium policy service : Pro NNP Care . text: A source tells NNS of the hosts ' work during the NN NN , " They ’ve all been doing a great job keeping the show VBG . " From left to NN : ' View ' co-hosts Whoopi Goldberg and Meghan McCain during Monday 's taping . The panel was discussing the Democrats ' latest $ 3 trillion NN - CD relief bill proposal , which passed in the House of Representatives but is expected to be turned away in the Republican - controlled Senate . Some Republican lawmakers denounced the relief bill as a " liberal wish list " last week — a comparison McCain , 35 , repeated on Monday before Goldberg , 64 , sent the show to a commercial break as McCain was still talking . " How are we VBG to tax NNS if there 's no economy ? " McCain asked as Goldberg VBD viewers the show MD be RB RB and ushered a commercial break . McCain is the youngest and only conservative voice represented on The View 's daily panel and often clashes with her co-hosts , who largely lean left on political and JJ issues . The panels ' latest argument came when co-hosts Sunny Hostin and Joy Behar joined Goldberg in calling for the Democrats ' sweeping relief bill to pass in the Senate , with both hosts drawing on their own personal financial struggles in the past in forming their view on the issue . Hostin and Behar both VBD they VBP to VB the federal NN give more aid to struggling Americans , though Behar admitted the $ 3 trillion that Democrats requested MD be too much but that Congress is supposed to negotiate . Behar , 77 , argued the relief bill MD VB American workers and families who can't VB to work and are relying on unemployment insurance . Hostin , 51 , then escalated the discussion when she suggested Republican lawmakers have more cynical reasons to turn the relief package away . “ What this is really about is the ' haves ' not wanting the ' have nots ' to survive this and that is really , really serious , " Hostin VBD . " We have the money . We just do n't seem to have the money to save these NNS . This is what that 's about . " " That is just ridiculous , " McCain VBD as Goldberg tried to speak at the same NN . " It 's a Democrat wish list . " " Hold on , I just VBP to — just let me finish ... let me finish my point , " Goldberg interjected before sending the show to a commercial break as McCain continued speaking . When the show came RB , the panel moved on to talk about the growing public feud between NNP Donald NNP and former NNP Barack Obama , who appeared to criticize NNP 's handling of the NN during his virtual 2020 commencement speech over the weekend . The rivalry between the CD political figures is representative of the broader partisanship between those in the Republican and Democratic political parties , including the hosts of The View . “ I VBP at a certain point , we have to start talking to each other in the middle , " McCain VBD . " We have to start talking about the faults on both sides . ” As NN about the NN NN rapidly VBZ , NNP is committed to providing the most recent data in our coverage .
